Wroclaw Weekly Online At-A-Glance Weekly City Guide to Wroclaw, Poland 2015-07-02T11:38:35Z WordPress http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/feed/atom/ toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Eklektik Session 2013]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=709 2013-01-31T14:10:33Z 2013-01-31T14:09:40Z Eklektik Session 2013
03.02.2013 -19.00 (Sunday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Tickets: 30/20PLN (40/30PLN before the concert)

“Eklektik Session” was launched in 2004 with an aim to provide a unique platform of interaction between musicians and artists of various genres & backgrounds. Today “Eklektik Session” is still one of the kind in the Wrocław music scene, and it offers a dynamic live session by professional musicians. This inaugural session of the new 2013 edition introduces HANG EM HIGH trio and followed by “THE NIGHT” - a special tribute concert to band Morphine.

______________
HANG EM HIGH
Bond / 2string slide bass
Alfred Vogel / drums, percussion
Lucien Dubuis / tenor sax, bass & contrabass clarinet
_______________________________
“THE NIGHT” TRIBUTE TO MORPHINE
Thymn Chase / Boston USA
Jerome Woodruff / Boston USA
Ranjit Prasad / USA
Alfred Vogel / Austria
Lucien Dubuis / Szwajcaria
Bond (Miloopa / Fat Burning Step)
Andrzej Strzemżalski (LOV)
Przemek Gibki (Miloopa, Fat Burning Step)
Olga Kończak (Digit All Love)
Olga Kwiatek (Digit All Love)
Tomek Kasiukiewicz
Michał Zygmunt

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2012: Benjamin Paulin]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=708 2012-03-24T16:46:49Z 2012-03-24T16:43:04Z

Teatr Lalek, 20.03.2012 - this is a fragment from the recording of the concert of Benjamin Paulin. The concert took place as a part of the official opening night of this year’s “Journées de la Francophonie” in Wrocław. In this video, you see Paulin perform the song from his new single: “Variations de Noir.”

“Journées de la Francophonie” in Wrocław is organized by Alliance Française Wrocław.

For more information about the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival, please check http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/ (PL/FR)

Download:
jf2012-paulin.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 40.86MB / 3:32)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2012: Piano Recital]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=706 2012-03-21T09:14:04Z 2012-03-21T09:12:01Z

This is the recording from the piano recital of François Dumont (at Wrocław Philharmonic Concert Hall on 17.03.2012). François Dumont is a prizewinner of the International Chopin Piano Competition in 2010, and this piano recital was the 1st concert of this year’s “Journées de la Francophonie” in Wrocław. 

“Journées de la Francophonie” in Wrocław is organized by Alliance Française Wrocław. For more information about the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival, please check http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/ (PL/FR)

Download:
jf2012-dumont.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 77.45MB / 6:50)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Serenissima Wratislavia]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=704 2012-01-18T22:16:36Z 2012-01-18T22:16:36Z 22.01.2012 - 15:00 (Sunday)
Cultural Center ZAMEK
(pl. Świętojański 1, Leśnica)
Free Admissions

Serenissima Wratislavia is a dance group specialized in the reconstruction of 15th & 16th century court dance. At the occasion of this carnival period, Serenissima Wratislavia will present some of the old dances and give a dance workshop.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dance from North Rhine-Westphalia]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=702 2011-10-10T09:52:29Z 2011-10-10T09:52:29Z 13 & 14.10.2011 - 20:00 (Thursday & Friday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)

“Sezon Kultury Nadrenii Północnej-Westfalii w Polsce (The North Rhine-Westphalia Culture in Poland, Season 2011-12)” is the first multidisciplinary arts festival to introduce the variety & vitality of performing arts in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, to the Polish public.

The performances on the program are prepared by the prominent choreographers: Ben J. Riepe, Silke Z., and Caroline Simon.

13.10.2011 (Thursday)
Ben J. Riepe Kompanie “Hundstage”

14.10.2011 (Friday)
Silke Z. / resistdance “Private spacer (the unplugged version)”
Caroline Simon “Stück”



]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mitlos]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=701 2011-06-30T12:28:48Z 2011-06-30T12:28:48Z 03.07.2011 - 17:00 (Sunday)
SYNAGOGUE “UNDER A WHITE STORK”
(Synagoga Pod Białym Bocianem / ul.Włodkowica 7)
Ticket: 35/25PLN (To make a reservation, contact at promotion@fbk.org.pl or call 71 782 81 23 or 71 341 89 47)

From 26.06 through the end of August, the “Summer at the Synagogue (Lato w Synagodze pod Białym Bocianem)” concert series organizes a concert on every Sunday at 17:00. On 03.07, the guest is a folk music group “Mitlos.”

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Eklektik Session: FBS + Blu Rum 13]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=700 2011-06-16T05:45:00Z 2011-06-16T05:43:34Z 19.06.2011 - 20:00 (Sunday)
ETER (ul. Kazimierza Wielkiego 19)
Ticket: 35/29PLN

“Eklektik Session” was created in 2005, with an aim to provide a unique platform of interaction between musicians and artists of various genres & backgrounds. Today “Eklektik Session” is still one of the kind in the Wrocław music scene, and it offers a dynamic live electronic / dub / dubstep jam session. Fat Burning Step (a.k.a. FBS) (www.fatburningstep.com) leads the session, with the participation of the special guest: Blu Rum 13.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mandala Performance Festival 2011]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=699 2011-05-19T08:44:52Z 2011-05-19T08:44:52Z

20-22.05.2011
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Tickets: 20/15PLN per performance

Mandala Performance Festival is an annual international festival of contemporary performing arts. In program are tango, solo performances, workshops, talks & panel discussions. Here are the list of performances:

- Dominika Knapik & Dobrochna Krówka “Moskwa” - Fri 19:00
- Maria Dolores Silvestro (AR) & Konrad Szymański “Tango Argentino” - Sat 19:00
- Marta Ziółek “Frame” - Sat 19:30
- Konrad Szymański “I N E V O L U T I O N A R Y” // Katarzyna Źejmo “Mleko” - Sun 19:30

For more information about the artists and performance: mandalaperformance.blogspot.com

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2011: Exhibitions]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=698 2011-04-08T05:25:41Z 2011-04-08T05:25:41Z

During this year’s “Journées de la Francophonie” festival, 3 exhibitions were organized. In this video are the views from their opening receptions. The first exhibition in the video is the exhibition of collages by the renowned Polish artist Hanna Bakuła on the theme of Frédéric Chopin’s life. The second fragment presents the opening reception at the exhibition of photos by 2 students of the International University of Logistics and Transport (Międzynarodowa Wyższa Szkoła Logistyki i Transportu we Wrocławiu) on “Paris en hiver (Winter in Paris).” The third and the last potion of the video is from the opening reception of the photo exhibition “Vue d’un quartier: Photographie de Nadodrze,” a project of Lorette Guillou (FR) realized with Fundacja Dom Pokoju (the House of Peace Foundation) in Wrocław.

For more information about the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival, please check http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/

Download:
jf2011-exhibitions.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 32.44MB / 2:46)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly







]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2011: Nouvelle Vague]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=697 2011-04-04T05:59:35Z 2011-04-04T05:59:35Z

This is the recording from the concert of Nouvelle Vague on 25.03.2011 at Club ETER (ul. Kazimierza Wielkiego 19), with the fragments from the songs: “Je suis déjà partie,” “Master and Servant” & “Heart of Glass.”

The concert was presented as part of the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival. For more information about the festival, please check http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/

Download:
jf2011-nouvelle_vague.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 82.88MB / 7:13)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly







]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2011: Axoum Duo]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=695 2011-03-23T20:08:15Z 2011-03-23T20:08:15Z

22.03.2011 at ORATORIUM MARIANUM (pl. Uniwersytecki 1) - On the second day of the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival, Axoum Duo - Elwira Ślązak (PL) & Gabriel Collet (FR) - played a concert of 2 marimbas. The tunes featured in this video are: “Tango-Prélude” (based on F. Chopin’s Prélude 4 op.28) followed by “Prélude-Voyage” (variations on F. Chopin’s Prélude nr. 15 D bémol-majeur op.28), both of which are composed by Axoum Duo’s Gabriel Collet.

For more information about the festival, please check http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/

Download:
jf2011-axoum-duo.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 63.36MB / 5:25)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly







]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2011: Concert of Arias]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=693 2011-03-22T14:07:47Z 2011-03-22T14:06:35Z

21.03.2011 at ORATORIUM MARIANUM (pl. Uniwersytecki 1) - This is a fragment of the concert of opera arias by Nikolay Dorozhkin, the distinguished Russian tenor with the Wrocław Opera, accompanied by the pianist Olga Rusina. The concert was performed at the opening of the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival. The aria featured in this video is “La fleur que tu m’avais jetée” from the opera “Carmen.”

For more information about the festival, please check http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/

Download:
jf2011-opera.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 42.40MB / 3:35)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly







]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Journées de la Francophonie 2011]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=691 2011-03-17T14:53:22Z 2011-03-17T14:52:19Z 21.03-10.04.2011

At the occasion of the international day of “Francophonie” (20.03), Alliance Française in Wrocław organizes the “Journées de la Francophonie” festival. As the title indicates, the guiding theme of the festival is French language and the culture of French-speaking people beyond national boundaries. For the complete program, please see: http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/ (FR/PL)

 

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[O/R (Optical Reader)]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=690 2011-03-17T14:47:41Z 2011-03-17T14:45:06Z 22.03.2011 - 21:00 (Tuesday)
OPT (Ośrodek Postaw Twórczych / ul. Działkowa 15)
Ticket: 15PLN

O/R is a new multimedia performance project from Todd Carter and Raymond Salvatore Harmon (US) (previously seen in Wrocław with Exploding Star Orchestra from Chicago: here). The performance will be accompanied by the concert by G. Lebik/A.Majewski/K.Suchar, a trio from Wrocław.

For more info on O/R:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9BZdWl3_APc
www.o-r.tv

///////O/R: The Nearer East Tour///////
Poland - March - 2011

March 22 Wroclaw @ OPT
March 23 Lodz @ Jazzga
March 24 Warsaw @ Powiekszenie
March 25 Torun @ CoCarts Festival (RSH w/ PAS+HATI)
March 26 Torun @ CoCarts Festival
March 27 Poznan @ Dragon

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Eklektik Session 03.2011]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=689 2011-03-10T09:48:28Z 2011-03-10T09:46:20Z 17.03.2011 - 21:00 (Thursday)
ETER (ul. Kazimierza Wielkiego 19)
Ticket: 10PLN

“Eklektik Session” was created in 2005, with an aim to provide a unique platform of interaction between musicians and artists of various genres & backgrounds. Even today “Eklektik Session” is one of the kind in the Wrocław music scene, and it offers a dynamic live electronic / dub / dubstep jam session.

Fat Burning Step (www.fatburningstep.com) leads the session, with the participation of the special guests: Jahga (vocals), Michał Malicki (vocals), Jan Krzeszowiec (flute), Olga Kończak (cello), Tomek Kasiukiewicz (trombone), Jarek Długosz (audio mix) & Spaso (turntables).

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dance Vibrations 02.2011]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=688 2011-02-03T09:35:09Z 2011-02-03T09:34:02Z

05.02.2011 - 19:00 (Saturday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Ticket: 25/20PLN

The February edition of the contemporary dance & art performance series “Wibracje Taneczne” - “Dance Vibrations” - presents 3 solo performances:
“Lost in details” by Aleksandra Borys
“the truth is just a plain picture. said bob” by Anna Nowicka
“Mt 9,7” by Rafał Urbacki

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[The Christmas Oratorio]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=687 2011-01-06T08:29:41Z 2011-01-06T08:29:41Z

8 & 9.01.2011 - 18:00 (Saturday & Sunday)
WROCŁAW PHILHARMONIC CONCERT HALL (ul. Piłsudskiego 19)
Ticket: 30/20PLN

Wrocław Baroque Orchestra and Wrocław Philharmonic Choir will perform J. S. Bach’s Christmas Oratorio (Weihnachtsoratorium). The Christmas Oratorio is in 6 parts, and each part corresponds to a Christian feast between Christmas and Epiphany. With soloists: Anna Mikołajczyk (soprano), Ewa Marciniec (alt), Marcus Ullmann (tenor) and Jarosław Bręk (bass).

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Didgeridoo Workshop]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=686 2010-12-16T12:18:12Z 2010-12-16T12:18:12Z 18.12.2010 - 12:00 (Saturday)
MARRAKECH (ul. Kurzy Targ 3)

Didgeridoo workshops by TOM FRONZA for both beginner & intermediate levels. The workshop will be held in English. For more infomation & sign up, please contact: workshop@gig-ant.pl, +48 602 744 845.

Tom Fronza will play on Monday (20.12.2010) also at the Marrakech Club along with the Wrocław-based live Drum’n’Bass duo, Fat Burning; the concert will start at 21:00.


Content Workshop Intermediate:
- Deepening the consciousness of the technical aspects of circular breathing and drone
- Easy rhythm patterns (2 beat, 4 beat and 6 beat) with a syllable playing scheme
- Odd meters (3 beat, 5 beat, 11 beat) with a syllable playing scheme
- Using the toungue as main rhythm source
- Different Toot (trumpet) techniques
- Breathing on Toot
- Additional sounds and rhythms with cheeks, diaphragm and voice
- Musical base knowledge regarding playing the didgeridoo
- Workshop revisited with sound files and text documents (playing scheme)

Conent Workshop Beginner:
- Learning the drone
- Learning the circular breathing without the dig (4 step system)
- Refining the drone
- Theory and practise of different circulation approaches
- First, very simple rhythms
- Basic soundmodulation and voice integration
- Basic knowledge regarding the Instrument, focus on playing techniques and material

Tom Fronza on world didgeridoo network
http://www.didgeridoo-network.com/profile/TomFronza

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dance Vibrations 3]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=685 2010-12-09T06:56:56Z 2010-12-09T06:56:56Z

14.12.2010 - 19:00 (Tuesday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Ticket: 25/20PLN

The December edition of the contemporary dance & art performance series “Wibracje Taneczne” - “Dance Vibrations” - presents the performance “Sztuka pływania (Art of Swimming)” by Justyna Jasłowska and also the spectacle “Between STH & STH” by Katarzyna Mróz & Kinga Boruń. For more info: http://tinyurl.com/dance122010 (PL)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Eklektik Session: Rebooted]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=684 2010-11-11T10:15:09Z 2010-11-11T10:13:06Z 11.11.2010 - 21:00 (Thursday)
PUZZLE (Przejście Garncarskie 2, Rynek)
Ticket: 20PLN

“Eklektik Session” was created in 2005, with an aim to provide a unique platform of interaction between musicians and artists of various genres & backgrounds. After 4 years of hiatus, it returns with a live electronic/dub/dubstep jam session by Fat Burning (PL), featuring Maria Payne (GB) in vocal and Roli Mosimann (CH) in live sound & FX engineer. For more info: eklektik.art.pl (EN/PL)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dance Vibrations 2]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=683 2010-10-19T20:01:05Z 2010-10-19T19:57:02Z 21.10.2010 - 19:00 (Thursday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Ticket: 25/20PLN

The October edition of the contemporary dance & art performance series “Wibracje Taneczne” - “Dance Vibrations” - presents “line” by Irena Lipińska and also “Mijanie” by Teatr Tańca Vogue. For more info, please see: impart.art.pl (PL)

To watch videos from the past performances of Wibracje Taneczne, please check here.

 

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Leopoldinum for Philharmonic 2010/2011]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=682 2010-10-01T05:25:43Z 2010-10-01T05:24:07Z 03.10.2010 - 18:00 (Sunday)
WROCŁAW PHILHARMONIC CONCERT HALL (ul. Piłsudskiego 19)
Ticket: 30/20PLN

A special concert by Wrocław Chamber Orchestra “Leopoldinum” opens the season 2010/2011 of the Wrocław Philharmonic. With the soloist Gośka Isphording in harpsichord, the “Leopoldinum” will perform the world premiere of Hanna Kulenty’s “GG Harpsichord Concerto.”
For more info: www.leopoldinum.art.pl

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Kenneth Flak - “God Studies #3″]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=681 2010-09-25T19:49:21Z 2010-09-25T07:03:57Z

This is the belated release of the recording of a dance performance - “God Studies #3″ - by Kenneth Flak (NO). It was recorded during the Mandala Festival 2010 (24.04.2010) at IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17). In this performance, Flak traces the Norse mythology in 4 parts: “Odin,” “Thor,” “Loki” & “Ragnarök.”

Download:
mandala2010-flak.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 48.75MB / 4:58)
LQ version is also available: mandala2010-flak_lq.mp4 (320×180 / 25.72MB)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Sławek Dudar Quartet]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=680 2010-09-23T07:56:39Z 2010-09-23T07:56:06Z 26.09.2010 - 20:00 (Sunday)
MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
Ticket: 30/25PLN

An ethno-jazz concert by Sławek Dudar Quartet, promoting their new album “Brand New World.” With:
Sławek Dudar (alto sax)
Grzegorz Urban (piano)
Marcin Spera (contrabass)
Wojtek Buliński (percussions)
and also a special guest Emam (tabla/dumbak).

More at http://www.slawekdudar.com/

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Intimate Life of Mannequins]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=679 2010-09-23T07:51:15Z 2010-09-23T07:49:44Z

Pod Spódnicą (ul. Sempołowskiej 54a)
Admission Free
A photo exhibition - “Życie intymne manekinów (Intimate Life of Mannequins)” - by Barbara Maliszewska. Open through 15.10.10. More info on the photographer can be found at http://www.barbaramaliszewska.eu/ (PL/EN)


]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Quiet]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=675 2010-06-24T14:38:38Z 2010-06-24T14:30:20Z 28.06.2010 - 19:00 (Monday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Ticket: 25/20PLN

A Palestinian-Israeli dance project “Quiet,” directed by Arkadi Zaides, is a spectacle of co-existence and confrontation, and this is an artistic response to the events that the artists encounter in their everyday life.

 



]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Survival 8]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=672 2010-06-24T14:25:44Z 2010-06-24T14:23:05Z 25-27.06.2010 (Friday-Sunday)
THE BUNKER (pl. Strzegomski)

“Survival: Young Art in Extreme Conditions Review” is an annual contemporary art festival and it provides an important opportunity for young artists to present their works. Its key signature is the use of a public space for exhibitions and this year, the festival is held inside the bunker on pl. Strzegomski.

For more info: www.survival.art.pl (PL/EN)

Galeria ENTROPIA (ul. Rzeźnicza 4)
Free Admissions

Opening reception for the new photo exhibition “Podwórko (Courtyard)” by Dorota Podlaska. The exhibition is open through 23.07.2010.


]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[SIMCHA XII]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=666 2010-05-21T15:12:00Z 2010-05-21T14:53:36Z 23.05.2010-28.05.2010 (Sunday-Friday)

SIMCHA is Wrocław’s annual Jewish culture festival. The program for this 12th edition includes dance & graphic workshops, concerts, film projections, public debates and lectures.

 Concerts: 
At SYNAGOGUE “UNDER A WHITE STORK”
(Synagoga Pod Białym Bocianem / ul. Włodkowica 7)

23.05.2010 - 19:00 (Sunday)
Veszprémer Klezmer Band (HU)
Ticket: 35/30PLN

27.05.2010 - 19:00 (Thursday)
Cukunft
Ticket: 20/15PLN

 Film Projections: 
At MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
Films from the 7th International Film Festival “Jewish Motifs” (Warsaw 2010)
23.05 (Sun) & 24.05 (Mon) - 17:00
25.05 (Tue) - 16:00
26.05 (Wed) - 17:00
Free Admissions

For the complete program, please see: www.simcha.art.pl (PL)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dance: Chlewińska / Lipińska / Bazan]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=662 2010-05-18T09:57:55Z 2010-05-18T09:48:20Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Lonely Drifter Karen - “Fall Of Spring”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=660 2010-05-18T09:33:58Z 2010-05-18T09:33:16Z

Tanja Frinta, Marc Melia Sobrevias and Giorgio Menossi - a.k.a. “Lonely Drifter Karen” - are on tour for the promotion of their second album “Fall Of Spring.” More info and audio/video samples at: http://www.myspace.com/lonelydrifterkaren

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mandala Performance Festival]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=658 2010-04-22T12:06:08Z 2010-04-22T12:04:22Z 24 & 25.04.2010 (Saturday & Sunday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Ticket: 25/20PLN
Mandala Performance Festival is an annual international festival of contemporary performing arts.

Program:
 24.04.2010 - Saturday 
19:00
Sławek Bendrat (PL) - “pinku chirashi”
Kenneth Flak (NO) - “God Studies #3″

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Journées de la Francophonie 2010]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=651 2010-03-11T09:52:27Z 2010-03-11T09:51:14Z 15.03.2010 - 27.03.2010

To commemorate the establishment of the intergovernmental organization of “Francophones,” every year the SCAC (Service de coopération et d’action culturelle) in Wrocław organizes “Journées de la Francophonie” festival. The guiding theme of the festival is French language and the culture of Francophones beyond national boundaries.

The main events this year are the concert by Olivia Ruiz, a piano recital by Olga Rusina, and the theatre spectacle by Mata Gabin. There are also many other events prepared by Alliance Française Wrocław and other local organizations.

For the complete program, please see: http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/ (FR/PL)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Right Hemisphere]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=648 2010-03-09T11:38:53Z 2010-03-09T11:35:50Z 13.03.2010 - 19:00 (Saturday)
IMPART (ul. Mazowiecka 17)
Ticket: 25/20PLN

The 4th installment of the contemporary dance series - “Wibracje Taneczne / Dance Vibrations” - presents “Prawa półkula (Right Hemisphere)” by the choreographer Marysia Stokłosa. The title makes a reference to the right hemisphere of the human brain, and the project is inspired by and aims to explore the qualities attributed to that side of the brain, such as spatial abilities, visual imaging and music.

Prawa półkula
choreography: Marysia Stokłosa
light: Jan Cybis
dramaturgy: Peter Pleyer
costume: Ola Staszko
with music by: LeTigre, Nina Simone, Erik McKenzie
dancers: Aleksandra Borys, Halina Chmielarz, Hana Lee Erdman (US), Joanna Leśnierowska, Weronika Pelczyńska

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Forum of Possibility 2009]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=639 2010-03-27T10:02:52Z 2010-01-15T14:05:48Z

The ARKA Theatre in Wrocław regularly organizes theatre workshops for people with intellectual disabilities or mental illness for the purpose of social and professional rehabilitation. Their public-funded project “Forum Możliwości (Forum of Possibility)” aims to extend their service to other cities in Lower Silesia, and in 2009, they organized the 2nd edition of the project.

From July through November 2009, we followed their workshops held in various cities of Lower Silesia and documented the project in video. During the documentation, we interviewed several people working daily with those with disabilities or illness and asked them about the benefit of theatre workshop as a method of rehabilitation.

Download:
forum2009.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 73.58MB / 7:47)
LQ version is also available: forum2009_lq.mp4 (320×180 / 40.20MB)


This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Digit-All-love Soundsystem at Mleczarnia]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=638 2010-03-27T10:02:59Z 2010-01-04T09:58:45Z

11.11.2009 at MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5) - Digit-All-love is a Wrocław-based trip-hop band, and “Digit-All-love Soundsystem” is its chamber version, taking away the live drum, guitar and bass, and keeping only the vocal, strings and electronic sounds. This video features a new track from their upcoming 2nd album.

With: Natalia Grosiak, Olga Kończak, Maciek Zakrzewski, and Magda Olearczyk & Wojtek Bolsewicz. For more info on Digit-All-love can be found at: myspace.com/digitalllove

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Liquidmime: Virtual Humanity]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=626 2009-11-27T08:04:55Z 2009-11-27T08:01:44Z 27.11.2009 - 20:00 (Friday)
POD SPÓDNICĄ (ul. Sempołowskiej 54a)
Ticket: 5PLN

“Virtual Humanity” is the first solo performance of Jim Williams (US). The performance is a result of the 10 years of his etudes in clowning, pantomime, beatbox and dance. The play shows the absurd practice of the human race and the tangled relationships of people with machines.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[St. Francis, Everyman’s Dream]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=621 2009-11-19T05:33:26Z 2009-11-05T06:26:36Z

07.11.2009 - 17:00 (Saturday)
LALEK (PUPPET) THEATRE (pl. Teatralny 4)
The premiere of a new puppet theatre play, written by Mateusz Pakuła. The play “St. Francis, Everyman’s Dream” updates and transposes the story of St. Francis of Assisi to our everyday life and shows its relevance to everyone’s life even today. The puppet design & scenography by Barbara Hanicka, music by Paweł Hendrich.
For more info here (in Polish)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Pierina Bencetti]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=615 2009-10-22T12:00:02Z 2009-10-22T12:00:02Z 28.10.2009 - 20:00 (Wednesday)
RURA (ul. Łazienna 4)
Ticket: 18/12PLN

French singer Pierina Bencetti will sing compositions of Léo Ferré and some of her own. Léo Ferré is one of the most famous composers of French popular songs and he also composed accompanying tunes for poems by François Villon, Charles Baudelaire, Arthur Rimbaud and other well-known French poets.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Paper Theatre: Les frères corses]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=614 2010-03-27T10:03:15Z 2009-10-15T12:49:08Z

On 26.09.2009, at the Wrocław Puppet Theatre (Teatr Lalek / pl. Teatralny 4), as a part of the European Day of Languages events, Alexandre Marquézy and Patrycja Łacina-Miarka performed a paper theatre play “Les frères corses (The Corsican Brothers)” in French. The project of the paper theatre at the Wrocław Puppet Theatre aims to reproduce the paper theatre of the 19th century when this form of theatre was very popular. During the preparation of this performance in French, however, the actors decided to update the format. In our interview, Alexandre Marquézy tells us what change they made and why.

Download:
freres_corses.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 61.16MB / 6:41)
LQ version is also available: freres_corses_lq.mp4 (320×180 / 33.80MB)

Please use Quicktime or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[I Love Cinema]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=608 2009-10-14T22:44:33Z 2009-10-14T13:51:47Z I Love Cinema - The Magic of Motion Picture
16.10.2009-25.10.2009
ACF DWORCOWE
(ul. Piłsudskiego 105 / Main Railway Station)
Ticket: 13PLN/film
Carnets also available:
9 films (63PLN), 5 films (45PLN) or 3 films (30PLN)

The projection starts everyday at 20:00

The cinema ACF DWORCOWE organizes a series of special projections at the occasion of the 50th anniversary of independent cinemas in Poland. The center of this celebration is cinema itself, and the films in the programme also have “cinema” in the center.
Official site: http://www.acf.pl/images/Do_pobrania/50SKS.htm (PL)

Sto lat w kinie (PL, 1995, dir. Paweł Łoziński)

David Lynch, Roman Polański, Lars von Trier, Wim Wenders, David Cronenberg, Wong Kar Wai, Nanni Moretti, Takeshi Kitano, Bille August, Coen Brothers, Gus Van Sant, Atom Egoyan, Abbas Kiarostami, Claude Lelouch, Yimou Zhang, Walter Salles, Michael Cimino, Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu, Ken Loach, Kaige Chen, Aki Kaurismäki, Manoel de Oliveira, Theodoros Angelopoulos, Dardenne Brothers, and more)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[The European Day of Languages]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=606 2009-09-24T06:26:40Z 2009-09-24T06:23:52Z 26.09.2009 (Saturday)
LALEK (PUPPET) THEATRE (pl. Teatralny 4)



26th September is the European Day of Languages. At this occasion, Wrocław Puppet Theatre will organize “Theatrical Babel Tower,” presentations of a variety of theatrical performances aiming to promote theatre as a means of language education.

* * *

The European Day of Languages:
Theatrical Babel Tower
26 September 2009 (Saturday)

 13:30 
Ode to Joy
An open concert sung to the accompaniment of the Representative Orchestra of the Wrocław Police.
All are invited to join in!
Free Admissions

 13:45 
The official inauguration of the European Day of Languages and the opening of exhibitions prepared by Ősterreich Institut (”Austrian Children Literature”), by Alliance Française (”Migrating Words / Les mots migrateurs”) and the Wrocław Public Library (”Our Wroclaw Microcosm”).

 14:00 
“Mozart writing letters”
A theatre performance with an English lesson, performed in English
Ticket: 30/20PLN

 14:00 
“Fairy from Sonnwendjoch” – a performance in German played by pupils of PARNAS school
Free Admissions

 15:00 
“Konik Garbusek (The Humpbacked Horse)” – a performance in Polish
Ticket: 25/20PLN

 16:00 
“Broken Nails: About Marlene Dietrich” – a performance in English
A monodrame about Marlena Dietrich with her most beautiful songs performed by Anna Skubik
Ticket: 30/20PLN

 17:00 
“Les frères corses (Corsican Brothers)”
A paper theatre performance in French
Free Admissions

 17:30 
A piano recital inaugurating the Porcelain Concerts series
Ticket: 25PLN

A pianist Tadeusz Domanowski will play works of Moritz Moszkowski - a composer born in Wroclaw - and also Frederic Chopin, Franz Liszt and Felix Mendelssohn.

  1.      F. Chopin – “Scherzo B minor op. 31″
  2.      F. Chopin – “Waltz A minor (op. posth.)”
  3.      F. Liszt – “Petrarch Sonnet No. 104″
  4.      F. Liszt – “Obermann’s Valley” from “Years of Pilgrimage” (interpretation by Vladimir Horowitz)
  5.      M. Moszkowski – “Spanish Caprice op. 37″
  6.      M. Moszkowski – “Sparks”
  7.      F. Liszt – ‚Liebestraum No. 3 in A-flat major”
  8.      F. Mendelssohn and F. Liszt – varations on “Wedding March” from “A Midsummer Night”s Dream” (interpretation by Vladimir Horowitz)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Di Galitzyaner Klezmorim]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=603 2009-09-10T08:59:39Z 2009-09-10T08:53:32Z Concert: Di Galitzyaner Klezmorim

13.09.2009 - 19:00 (Sunday)
SYNAGOGUE “UNDER A WHITE STORK” (Synagoga Pod Białym Bocianem / ul. Włodkowica 7)
Ticket: 25/20PLN

The name of this award-winning trio from Kraków - “Di Galitzyaner Klezmorim” - means in Yiddish “Galician musicians,” and as the name indicates, their music has its root in the tradition of Jewish vocal music of the Central-Eastern Europe. With Mariola Śpiewak in clarinet, Grzegorz Śpiewak in accordion, and Rafał Seweryniak in contrabass.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Between East and West]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=601 2009-09-03T14:45:32Z 2009-09-03T14:43:34Z Festival “Between East and West”
19.09.2009-08.10.2009

The festival “Between East and West” (Festiwal Między Wschodem a Zachodem) is a festival promoting Russian culture with the specific focus on the Orthodox Church and its culture and traditions, and this is its 2nd edition this year. In programme are

- the screenings of the film “Ostrov (Island)” (RU, 2006, dir. Pavel Lungin)

- a photo exhibition “Polish Orthodox Church” (photography by Piotr Sawicki)

- the concerts by an internationally acclaimed basso profundo, Vladimir Miller

For more info: http://www.miedzywschodemazachodem.art.pl/

19.09.2009 - 19:00
Film “Ostrov (Island)”
ACF DWORCOWE (ul. Piłsudskiego 105 / Main Railway Station)
Ticket: 8/6PLN
The film is in Russian with Polish subtitles.

22.09.2009 - 18:00
The opening of the photo exhibition “Polish Orthodox Church”
ETHNOGRAPHIC MUSEUM (ul. Traugutta 111/113)

23.09.2009 - 08.10.2009
Photo exhibition “Polish Orthodox Church”
ETHNOGRAPHIC MUSEUM (ul. Traugutta 111/113)
The museum is open from Tuesday through Sunday from 10 AM to 4 PM
Ticket: 5/3PLN; on Saturdays the entrance is free

25.09.2009 - 18:00
Concert: “The Songs of Russian Soul” by Vladimir Miller
GALERIA ZAMKOWA, Lubin
Ticket: 25PLN (30PLN at the door) or 15PLN (20PLN at the door)

29.08.2008 (Saturday)
“Funk Voyage” is a party boat trip on Odra river. The 2nd edition this year, while the boat cruises around Wrocław, 2 DJ’s - Dr Oldskool and Ciety - will live-mix the retro funk from the ’60s, ’70s and ’80s.
———-

DEPARTURE from the Odra river bank behind the National Museum (pl. Powstanców Warszawy 5) [See it on the map]

You must be over 18 years of age.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dramatic Reading: “Jan Karski”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=599 2009-08-19T10:14:18Z 2009-08-19T10:04:20Z 21.08.2009 - 19:30 (Friday)
EVANGELICAL CHURCH OF DIVINE PROVIDENCE
(Kościół Ewangelicko-Augsburski Opatrzności Bożej / ul. Kazimierza Wielkiego 29)
Free Admission

“Jan Karski: One of the Great Men of Polish Resistance”
The text written by Marc P. Smith (US)
Performed in English by the theater group “Turning the Page”

From the press release:
“The renowned playwright Marc P. Smith, Boston, USA, continues to follow his life’s goal to remember examples of heroic resistance against the Nazis in Poland and Germany.

After long research and many personal encounters with surviving family members he wrote in 2007 his play A Journey to Kreisau about Helmuth James and Freya von Moltke, who ‘identified and strengthened the moral standards within their group… and it was his vision, that endured.’

Now Smith remembers the life of Jan Karski, who worked in life threatening situations for Sikorski’s Exile government to try to stop the Holocaust in Poland – but nobody in London or Washington, where he met Roosevelt in 1943, believed his eyewitness of Oswiecim / Auschwitz.

The playwright Marc P. Smith will coach young Polish and German actors during the Workshop DenkFest-1 in Krzyzowa / Kreisau for this and further performances and will be present at the premiere in Wroclaw. He says: ‘Jan Karski is essential for young people today to identify with heroes of their own country so that they may learn to stand up for ethical values.’”

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From the Archive: Mandala Festival 2009]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=597 2010-03-27T10:03:24Z 2009-08-04T08:12:35Z

This is the recording from the Mandala Performance Festival 2009 (24.04-26.04.2009), recorded on 25.04.2009 at Galeria Miejska (ul. Kiełbaśnicza 28). The Mandala festival is an annual international art performance festival, and the themes of this year were 1) the meeting of art performance and choreography and 2) the question of identity and alienation. In this video, Adam Kamiński - the curator of the festival - elaborates on the selection of these themes.

For more info: mandalaperformance.blogspot.com
You can find our video podcasts from the previous editions of Mandala festival here: http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?s=mandala+mp4

Download:
mandala2009.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 93.19MB / 9:27)
LQ version is also available: mandala2009_lq.mp4 (320×180 / 48.59MB)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Young Classic Wratislavia]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=592 2009-07-09T22:02:36Z 2009-07-09T22:02:36Z 11.07.2009 - 19:00 (Saturday)
ST. MARIA MAGDALENA CHURCH (ul. Szewska 10)
Tickets: 20/10PLN

A classical music concert by Polsko-Niemiecka Młoda Filharmonia Dolny Śląsk (Polish-German Lower Silesia Youth Philharmonic). In program are:
J. S. Bach / L. Stokowski - “Toccata & Fuga d-moll”

Every year, “Young Classic Wratislavia” presents the works of young musicians passionate about classical music, and it is already its 6th edition this year. After the concert in Wrocław, the Youth Philharmonic will play in Oleśnica (Sunday 12.07, 16:00), Świdnica (Monday 13.07, 19:00) and then continue the tour to Germany: Dresden, Reichenbach and Pirna (14, 15, 16.07 respectively).




]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From the Archive: LILA]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=591 2010-03-27T10:03:52Z 2009-07-02T21:54:16Z

Once again, it is the season for cleaning our video backlog. For the next few weeks, we will be editing and publishing the materials from our archive. The first video in this summer clearance series is the recording from the concert of LILA at MLECZARNIA on 26.04.2009.
LILA is a free-style jazz quartet from Switzerland, and the concert took place as a part of “Swiss Club 2009.” “Swiss Club” is a project by Gig-Ant, aiming to promote new (jazz) sounds of Swiss music scenes in Poland.

LILA:
Christoph Erb - tenorsaxophon, bassclarinet
Hans-Peter Pfammatter - keys, synth-bass
Flo Stoffner - guitar
David Meier - drums
For more info: www.li-la.ch

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Brave Festival: Prayers of the World]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=590 2009-06-29T13:54:01Z 2009-06-29T13:52:08Z 03.07.2009-11.07.2009
With the keyword “Against Cultural Exile,” each year Brave Festival brings to Wrocław traditional performing artists and musicians from all over the world.

This year’s focus is “Prayers of the World,” and the main feature is the presentation of various traditional rites of religiosity or spirituality. The program includes: a Zikr ritual by a women’s group from Georgia, a Tanzanian libation ritual, Korean mudang rituals, Corsican religious polyphonies, and also, from the UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage List, healing dance from Malawi, Ahellil chants of the Berbers of Algeria, and the Azer songs of Mugham.

Read more at http://www.bravefestival.pl (PL/EN)
日本語訳はこちら

The festival was started with the belief that, in the contemporary society, it is very difficult to keep traditional cultural forms without making compromises and that it takes unusual courage and perseverance to do so. The name of the festival (”Brave”) is literally a homage to those people who are brave enough to stand against the currents of modernization and have a courage to be a bridge to our own cultural heritage.


]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Photo Exhibition: Grey Days]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=589 2009-06-25T15:49:41Z 2009-06-25T15:40:11Z 27.06.2009 - 18:00 (Saturday)

The exhibition is open everyday at 18:00 and through 31.07.2009.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[New Sound Festival 2]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=587 2009-06-19T03:30:39Z 2009-06-18T08:04:38Z 18 & 19.06.2009 - 19:00 (Thursday & Friday)
WŁODKOWICA 21 (ul. Włodkowica 21)
Tickets: 15/10PLN

NowoBrzmienia (New Sound) Festival is a two-day festival promoting the ambitious, contemporary club music in Poland. This year, for the 2nd edition, the festival extended its invitation to the sound more various than last year (see our previous post): the guest bands experiment not only with trip-hop, electronica & jazz, but also with avant-pop, industrial, hip-hop and breakbeat. The lineups are:

Day 1 (Thursday): MORF, Furia Futrzaków, Astrrd Monroe
Day 2 (Friday): Quantifier + Toyo, Ms. No One, KiRK, Przaśnik

NowoBrzmienia is organized by Wrocławski Klub Formaty

Monday 06.04.2009, at OPT (Ośrodek Postaw Twórczych), Wrocław - Jazz drummer & composer Mike Reed from Chicago played a concert with his band “People, Places & Things.” Before the concert, he talked to us about the project “People, Places & Things” and the idea behind it.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Giving Voice: Harmonic Accord]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=577 2009-04-19T07:00:37Z 2009-04-17T08:22:28Z 18.04.2009-26.04.2009
“Giving Voice” is an international festival of vocal art forms, created in Wales by the Centre for Performance Research. This year, as a part of its “Grotowski Year 2009″ celebration, the Grotowski Institute has brought the festival to Wrocław.

The main feature of the festival is vocal workshops, but there are also daily concerts, meetings & presentations open to the general public. For the details of the events & tickets information, please see below.

More information about the festival and the tickets are available at: www.rokgrotowskiego.pl

 Concerts: 
Sunday 19th

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2009 - Nuru Kane]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=576 2010-03-27T10:04:08Z 2009-04-16T21:47:39Z

On Friday 20.03.2009, Nuru Kane and his band “Baye Falle Gnawa” played a concert at Jazz Club Rura. The music of Nuru Kane mixes the sound of West Africa with the rhythm of Maghreb. The concert took place as a part of Journées de la Francophonie 2009.

Download:
nuru_kane.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 43.67MB / 4:43)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2009 - Agrapart & Cie]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=574 2010-03-27T10:04:15Z 2009-04-03T08:55:00Z

Monday 16.03.2009, Teatr Lalek - at the gala evening of this year’s Journées de la Francophonie fesvial, a French dance company Marie-Laure Agrapart & Cie, led by dancer/choreographer Marie-Laure Agrapart, performed a piece entitled “Àuctor.” “Àuctor” takes its inspiration from the poetry of Anna Akhmatova, and the dance - performed here by 4 female dancers - is an essay on the theme of femininity in confrontation with silence.

Download:
auctor.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 70.55MB / 7:05)
LQ version is also available: auctor_lq.mp4 (320×180 / 36.02MB)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mike Reed’s People, Places & Things]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=570 2009-04-02T21:08:09Z 2009-04-02T21:02:16Z 06.04.2009 - 20:00 (Monday)
OPT (Ośrodek Postaw Twórczych / ul. Działkowa 15)
Ticket: 30PLN
Jazz Concert

Mike Reed (US) presents his new project “People, Places & Things” at OPT this coming Monday. His quartet will play jazz compositions from Chicago in 1954-1960 (among others, those by Muhal Richard Abrams & Sun Ra). The audio samples available at: http://mikereedmusic.com/proliferation.cfm

Mike Reed - percussion
Jason Roebke - contrabass
Greg Ward - alto sax
Tim Haldeman - tenor sax

About Mike Reed (From the press release):
——————————————-

Mike Reed is a musician, composer and presenter based in Chicago.

As a drummer, Reed has been part of the vibrant Chicago jazz and improvised music community since 1997. He has performed regularly with David Boykin, Nicole Mitchell, Jeff Parker, Axel Doerner, Josh Abrams, Jim Baker, Rob Mazurek and others. As a leader Reed has released two critically acclaimed albums by his cross-genre group The Treehouse Project, and, more recently, the debut recording of his quintet Loose Assembly and a record of improvised duets. He currently is a member of The David Boykin Expanse, Rob Mazurek’s Exploding Star Orchestra and Josh Berman Quartet.

For nearly a decade Reed has also established himself as a presenter of musical performances. In 2001 Reed founded the Emerging Improvisers Organization, a not-for-profit whose weekly series of jazz and improvised music has been lauded as one of the finest in the Midwest. In December 2005 Reed was named among the Chicagoans of the Year by The Chicago Tribune for his work as lead organizer of the Intonation Music Festival.

http://mikereedmusic.com

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Revenant Sound]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=559 2010-03-27T10:04:35Z 2009-03-10T10:17:02Z

On Tuesday 17.02.2009, Galeria ENTROPIA hosted a sound performance entitled “Revenant Sound,” led by John Grzinich & Patrick McGinley. “Revenant Sound” is an open project around site-specific acoustics and sounds. The project is “open” first of all to the different sites and their physical as well as acoustic uniqueness. It is also “open” to the people present on a given site: it breaks down the barrier between “performer” and “spectator” and invites the public to take active part in the formation of a sound landscape. In our interview, Patrick McGinley elaborates more on the project and the sound.

This performance was presented as a part of the “Athletic_Cinema” series.

Download:
revenantsound.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 93.45MB / 9:51)
LQ version is also available: revenantsound_s.mp4 (320×180 / 52.26MB)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Journées de la Francophonie 2009]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=556 2009-02-23T22:06:35Z 2009-02-23T13:18:40Z 06.03.2009-22.03.2009
To commemorate the establishment of the intergovernmental organization of “Francophones,” every year around the 20th of March, SCAC (Service de coopération et d’action culturelle) in Wrocław organizes “Journées de la Francophonie” festival. The guiding theme of the festival is thus “Francophonie” – it is not only about France and French culture, but it also covers the culture, history and arts of French-speaking countries.

 Program 


Photo Exhibition : Le Paris polonais
04.03-20.03.2009
Klub Śląskiego Okręgu Wojskowego (ul. Pretficza 24)
Mon-Fri : 9:00-19:00 ; Sat : 10:00-14:00 // Opening reception (by invitation only) will be held on 09.03.2009 - 18:00 (Monday)

 06.03 (Friday) 
Projections of Canadian films (in original French with Polish subtitles)
Alliance française (Rynek 58)
Free admissions
10:30 La vie secrète des gens heureux (1:45)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Grotowski Year 2009]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=550 2009-01-09T11:19:27Z 2009-01-09T11:17:45Z For the 10th anniversary of the death of Jerzy Grotowski (1933-1999), The Grotowski Institute prepares events throughout the year 2009. Here is a quick view of the inauguration week (12.01-15.01):

 Monday 12.01.09 
16:00 - The Inauguration (at the Great Hall of Ratusz, Rynek) hosted by Ludwik Flaszen, Rena Mirecka, Zygmunt Molik
18:30 - The opening reception for the photo exhibition “Dust – ‘Apocalypsis cum figuris’” by Maurizio Buscarino (in the “Apocalypsis” Space of the Grotowski Institute, Rynek Ratusz 27)

 Tuesday 13.01.09 
21:00 - Film Projection: “Sacrilegious Rite, Abounding in Sorcery – On Jerzy Grotowski’s Laboratory Theatre,” directed by Krzysztof Domagalik (at the Ossolineum Institute, ul. Szewska 37)

 Wednesday 14.01.09 
21:00 - “Songs For Grot” - A concert by Bauls from West Bengal in India (at Museum of Architecture, ul. Bernardynska 5)

 Thursday 15.01.09 
21:00 - Meeting with Peter Brook (at the Ossolineum Institute)

International conference “Grotowski: what was, what is. And what is to be done” will also take place from Tuesday 13.01 through Thursday 15.01 at the Ossolineum Institute.

For more information: http://rokgrotowskiego.pl/

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays 3: Terra Incognita III]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=537 2010-03-27T10:05:38Z 2008-11-26T18:58:09Z

20.10.2008, OSSOLINEUM INSTITUTE (ul. Szewska 37) - Under the heading of “Terra Incognita III,” Zbigniew Pilch played various violin pieces from the 18th century. “Terra Incognita” is Pilch’s personal project, and it aims to present the compositions which are often confined in the academic and professional circles to the wider public. This concert took place as the second concert in this year’s “Enjoy Mondays” (”Polubisz Poniedziałki”) festival.

The next concert of “Enjoy Mondays” will take place this coming Monday (01.12.2008) at Browar Mieszczański (ul. Hubska 44-48). The title is “Interactions,” and Jagoda Szmytka (electronics), Marta Niedźwiecka (harpsichord) and Elżbieta Woleńska (flute) will play compositions from the 17th & 18th centuries as well as from the 21st century.

Download:
terra_incognita_3_b.mp4 (640×360 / H.264 / AAC / 49.97MB / 5:25)
LQ version is also available: terra_incognita_3.mp4 (320×180 / 27.83MB)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Digit-All-love @ WZ]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=535 2008-11-26T15:05:13Z 2008-11-26T15:04:16Z 01.12.2008 - 20:30 (Monday)
STREFA WZ (Pl. Wolności 7)
Tickets: 15PLN

The local Trip-Hop orchestra Digit-All-love will play a concert at the finale of Wrocławski Festiwal Form Muzycznych (Wrocław Music Form Festival). “Festiwal Form Muzycznych” is a music competition for amateur bands of various genres, organized by Światowid (www.swiatowid.net.pl). The concerts by this year’s winners will start at 18:00.

For more info about Digit-All-love, please see: myspace.com/digitalllove

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mademoiselle Karen]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=533 2008-11-26T14:59:44Z 2008-11-26T14:57:39Z 30.11.2008 - 20:30 (Sunday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Ritual VII]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=531 2008-11-20T08:53:57Z 2008-11-20T08:51:43Z 21.11.2008 (Friday)
“Ritual (Rytuał Mediów)” is an annual mini art festival and its guiding idea is to problematize the relation between the human and the media and express it by the use of art. This year, its 7th edition will take place on the World Television Day (21.11) and many events will be organized in various locations in Wrocław city center. All events are for free, except for the closing concert at Sala Gotycka. Here is the list of events:

16:20 - Galeria Entropia (ul. Reźnicza 4)
Performance: “TransRadioForma” - by Art&Industrial Gallery

17:00 - Museum of Architecture (ul. Bernardynska 5)
Project: “Włączeni/wykluczeni/Wieszaki” - by Viola Tycz

17:40 - Mieszkanie Gepperta (ul. Ofiar Oświęcimskich 1/2)
Performance: “Hydroksyzinum 2:0″ - by Art&Industrial Gallery 

18:20 - Empik (Rynek)
Concert by “Vilgoć” with video by Art&Industrial Gallery 

19:00 - Bar Miś (ul. Kuźnicza)
Exhibition: “Sport i pogoda” - by Antek Wajda 

19:30 - Galeria Miejska (ul. Kiełbaśnicza 28)
Performance: “TranSfera”  - by Suka Off 

20:30 -  Kamfora (ul. św Antoniego)
Performance & Presentation by Yolanta Ponton

21:11 - BWA Awangarda (ul. Wita Stwosza 32)
Happening: “CRASH antyrytuał” - by Robert B:Lisek+Gerard Lebik 

22:00 - Sala Gotycka (ul. Purkyniego 1)
Ticket: 20PLN
Concert: Synta[XE]rror, Krew z kontaktu
Installation: Art&Industrial Gallery  Film: “Terrorwizja” by Jacek Szleszynski  

01:00 - Kalaczakra (ul. Kuźnicza 29a)
Afterparty: Acid TV

Organized by Industrial Art

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Macbeth at Pieśń Kozła Theatre]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=527 2008-11-13T04:48:38Z 2008-11-13T04:46:36Z 14 & 15.11.2008 - 20:00 (Friday & Saturday)
Pieśń Kozła Theatre (Song of the Goat Theatre / ul. Purkyniego 1, tel. 071/ 342-71-10)
Tickets: 30/20PLN
(For ticket reservation, please call: (+48) 71 342 71 10)

The award-winning theatre company Teatr Pieśń Kozła premieres its new production “Macbeth” this weekend. Here’s the performance schedule this month:

13.11.2008 - Open Dress Rehearsal
14 & 15.11.2008 - Premiere
27-29.11.2008


From the press release:
“‘Macbeth’ is born out of the ongoing experimentation and research of Teatr Piesn Kozla and is the fruit of our collaboration with the Royal Shakespeare Company. This performance explores the musicality of Shakespeare’s poetry – the company have been searching for the colours and sounds of Shakespearian language, while at the same time investigating the roots of this drama.

Whereas ‘Lacrimosa’ was the final stage of the company’s work on myth, ‘Macbeth’ continues the ensemble’s deep interest in tragedy (the company’s name comes from the Greek tragon ode meaning song of the goat) and opens up new spaces for artistic exploration. The first work-in-progress of ‘Macbeth’ was shown in February 2007 at the Swan Theatre (Royal Shakespeare Company) in Stratford-upon-Avon during the Complete Works festival.

Although we call these showings the premiere, our performances are, in fact, always work-in-progress. The audience will witness a stage in the constant development of this performance and in our search for new meanings within the drama.

The cast of this performance is international: with actors from England, Finland, Scotland, Wales and Poland.”

DIRECTOR: Grzegorz Bral
COSTUME DESIGN: Cristina Gonzalez
STAGE DESIGN: Mira Zelechower-Aleksiun, Grzegorz Bral
LIGHTING: Robert Balinski
INSTRUMENTS: Rafał Habel
MUSIC: arranged on the basis of songs of A Filetta (Corsica)

CAST:
Macbeth – Gabriel Gawin
Lady Macbeth – Anna Zubrzycki
Macduff – Ian Morgan
Duncan – Janusz Andrzejewski
Malcolm – Ewan Downie
Banquo – Kacper Kuszewski
Witch– Anu Salonen

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Jazztopad Festival 2008]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=524 2008-11-08T06:32:46Z 2008-11-08T06:11:35Z 08.11.2008-30.11.2008
Jazztopad is an international jazz festival with a twist: it has the predilection for the blend of jazz and classical music. The 5th edition this year welcomes Kenny Wheeler, Joanna MacGregor, John Taylor, Manu Katché, Andy Sheppard, Lutosławski Quartet, and many more guests from all around the world.

Here is the full programme:

(ul. Piłsudskiego 19)

DIANA TORTO – vocals

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Avant Music Festival: Lucas Niggli Drum Quartet]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=510 2010-03-27T10:06:09Z 2008-10-15T09:30:14Z

27.09.2008, FIRLEJ (ul. Grabiszyńska 56) - This is our second video podcast from Avant Music Festival (19.09.2008 - 27.10.2008), and we bring you the scenes from the concert of Lucas Niggli Drum Quartet “Beat Bag Bohemia.” Drum Quartet is Lucas Niggli’s one of the latest undertakings, and we asked him in the interview how this quartet started and what he had in mind when he composed for this percussions-only quartet.

Lucas Niggli Drum Quartet:
Rolando Lamussene - Djembe, Mbira, Voice, Percussion
Kesivan Naidoo - Drums, Percussion, Gongs
Peter Conradin Zumthor - Drums, Percussion, Gongs
Lucas Niggli - Drums, Percussion, Gongs

Lucas Niggli also appeared in the following episodes of our podcast:
Steamboat Switzerland
Niggli Quintet in Zoom

RURA (ul. Łazienna 4))

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Avant Music Festival: Małe Instrumenty]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=505 2010-03-27T10:06:27Z 2008-10-07T12:26:20Z

26.09.2008, MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5) - The local multi-instrumental group “Małe Instrumenty“ played a late-night concert as a part of Avant Music Festival (19.09.2008 - 27.10.2008). “Małe Instrumenty” means “Small instruments,” and as its name indicates, the stage is filled with many small instruments; Some of them look like toys for children and some others really are just toys for children. In the interview, we asked Paweł Romańczuk, a key member of the band, how they musically integrate the use of those toys that never seem to make the sounds we want, and how much of their performance involves improvisation.

Download:
avant_mi.mp4 (320×180 / H.264 / AAC / 39.61MB / 7:38)
High quality version is also available: avant_mi_b.mp4 (640×360 / 75.03MB)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays 3]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=502 2008-10-02T10:26:42Z 2008-10-02T10:16:17Z 06.10.2008 - 22.12.2008 (On Selected Mondays)
“Enjoy Mondays” (“Polubisz Poniedziałki”) is a mini-festival around classical music. This 3rd edition follows the same programming principle as the previous editions: each concert with a music from a different period and a different style. As a whole, the series of concerts forms an interesting quick tour of classical music.

TICKETS: films 7 PLN, concerts 16 PLN normal/13 PLN reduced (the ticket for the following concert will be 1 PLN less with the presentation of the ticket from the previous concert)

PROGRAMME:

 THE OPENING FILM PROJECTION: 
FADOS (2007) directed by Carlos Saura
06.10.2008 – 19:00
Cinema ACF Dworcowe (ul. Piłsudskiego 105/ inside the main railway station building)

 CHIAROSCURO 
Renaissance - Baroque
13.10.2008 – 20:00
ST. JOSEPH CHAPEL - ST. ADALBERT CHURCH
(kaplica św. Józefa - Kościół św. Wojciecha, pl. Dominikański 2)

Jan Tomasz Adamus organ

Dietrich Buxtehude (1637 - 1707) Praeludium in g
Johann Jakob Froberger (1616 – 1667) Toccata per elevatione in g
Girolamo Frescobaldi (1583 – 1643) Toccata in g
Dietrich Buxtehude Fuga in C
Jan Pieterszoon Sweelinck (1562 - 1621) Echo Fantasia
Jan Pieterszoon Sweelinck Pavana Lachrimae
Jan Pieterszoon Sweelinck Fantasia Chromatica
Anonim Upon la mi re
Johann Caspar Kerll (1627 - 1693) Passacaglia in d
Dietrich Buxtehude Passacaglia in d

 TERRA INCOGNITA III 
Classicism
20.10.2008 – 19:00
OSSOLINEUM CONFERENCE ROOM (ul. Szewska 37)

Zbigniew Pilch violin

Iwan Chandoszkin (1747 – 1804)

Sonate in a minor [Cantabile, Allegro, Allegro, Giga]

3 caprices: no. 1 in F major, no. 2 in f minor, no. 14 in B major
Johan Helmich Roman (1694 - 1758)
Assagio in c minor [Grave, Allegro, Siciliana, Presto]

 GLASS DUO 
Classicism – Romanticism
03.11.2008 – 19:00
OSSOLINEUM CONFERENCE ROOM (ul. Szewska 37)

Anna & Arkadiusz Szafraniec glassharp

Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756 – 91) 2nd movement of piano conerto in C major KV 467
Johann Sebastian Bach (1685 - 1750) Invention no. 8

 INTERACTIONS 
The Present
01.12.2008, - 19:00

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Jonquil - Live at Rura]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=497 2010-03-27T10:06:38Z 2008-09-19T19:53:08Z

12.09.2008, Jazz Club RURA (ul. Łazienna 4) - An Oxford-based band Jonquil performed their first concert in Poland. The sound in live was much livelier than the recorded version (you can find the samples on their myspace page: www.myspace.com/jonquiluk), and in our interview, Hugo Manuel and Sam Scott from the band explain this difference. In video, they also talk about the history of the band and how their music changed through the band’s development.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Avant Music Festival19.09.2008 - 27.10.2008]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=495 2008-09-25T20:18:26Z 2008-09-17T16:16:33Z

“Avant Music Festival” is a new international music festival around avant-garde sounds and experimental jazz music. For more info: www.avantmusic.pl (in PL only)
Here is the programme:

 19.09.2008 - Friday: Tickets: 22/15PLN 
FIRLEJ (ul. Grabiszyńska 56)
20:00 - Dawid Szczęsny (PL)

21:30 - Phil Minton Quartet (GB)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[French Literature & Culture in Paper Theatre]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=490 2008-09-11T13:09:44Z 2008-09-11T13:02:24Z 13.09 & 14.09.2008 (Sat & Sun)
Lalek (Puppet) Theatre (pl. Teatralny 4)

At this special edition of the series “Art of Reading: Paper Theatre (Sztuka czytania – Teatr papierowy),” the Lalek Theatre premieres 2 pieces taken from French authors’ works, with the presence of the director Jan Peszek.

The first piece - “Opowieści z ul. Broca (Contes de la rue Broca)” by Peirre Gripari - is for children, and the second piece - “Kręciek i plankton (Vercoquin et le plancton)” by Boris Vian - is for the grown-ups only.

The spectacles will begin on Saturday (13.09) at 16:00 and Sunday (14.09) at 12:00 - After the first piece, there will be a puppet theatre workshop for children, while the accompanying adults could enjoy the second piece.


The spectacles will be accompanied by another short piece - “Les frères corses” by Alexandre Dumas - in the classical paper theatre form.

There will be also a display of a great collection of paper theatres from 19th century, presented here by a French puppet theatre artist, Alain Lecucq. The collection contains more than 150 original paper theatres from England, France, Germany and other European countries.

The reading will be in Polish.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Jonquil (Oxford, GB) at Rura]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=485 2008-09-10T10:50:19Z 2008-09-10T10:47:51Z 12.09.2008 - 20:30 (Friday)
RURA (ul. Łazienna 4)
Tickets: 14/12/9PLN

This Friday, at Jazz Club Rura, Jonquil will perform one and the only concert in Poland.
audio samples: http://www.myspace.com/jonquiluk

Jonquil is an Oxford bedroom recording project turned band, centered around 20 year old Hugo Manuel.

In borrowing Kit Monteith, Ben Rimmer and Jody Prewett from young Oxford band Wait For Coniston along with Sam Scott from Youthmovies, the line up was expanded to include bouzouki, guitar, violin, drums, flugelhorn and double bass.

The band started with a desire to use acoustic instruments. Influenced by the likes of Joan Baez, The Microphones, Akron/Family, Swans and Stars of the Lid, Hugo spent a year collecting melodicas, reed organs, glockenspiels, dulcimers, whistles…

The result was ‘Sunny Casinos’: a late night listening album of beautiful & engrossing dark gentle songs, dense summer drones, fairground field recordings and creeped-out dusty attic music. Ten songs that are at once fizzing & clattering & wheezy… and slowly blossoming, twinkling & gossamer-like. Think Animal Collective at their most sun-dappled, Hood at their most intimate and some stumbled-upon eerie eastern European folk.
— text taken from the press release



All the above photos are released under Creative Commons license by Jonquil

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Exploding Star Orchestra]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=484 2010-03-27T10:07:06Z 2008-09-10T00:18:16Z

Last December, Exploding Star Orchestra played a concert in Wrocław and this week they are back in Poland. This time they are playing in Łodź, at a jazz club Jazzga, as a part of the Festival of Dialogue of Four Cultures 2008. To give you a taste of their performance, we present you here the recording from the last year’s concert in Wrocław with a brief interview with the director and composer of the orchestra, Rob Mazurek. It was recorded on 02.12.2007 at Lwow Cinema (ul. Hallera 15) and the concert was organized by OPT.

Download:
eso.mp4 (320×180 / H.264 / AAC / 37.19MB / 7:27)
High quality version is also available: eso_b.mp4 (640×360 / 72.82MB / 7:27)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Wratislavia Cantans]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=482 2008-09-04T10:41:26Z 2008-09-04T10:39:58Z 04.09.2008-14.09.2008
“Wratislavia Cantans” is the biggest international classical music festival in Dolny Śląsk (Lower Silesia) and this year it celebrates its 43rd edition. In our concert section, we list only the concerts held in Wrocław. If you are looking for the concert information in other cities, please check:
http://www.wratislavia.art.pl/programen.htm

09.07.2008, MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5) - “Czesław Śpiewa” is a music project by Czesław Mozil, and at the occasion of its 4th birthday, Café Mleczarnia invited Czesław to play 2 concerts (09.07.08 & 10.07.08). This video is from the first day of the concerts.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[W.EARTH]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=478 2008-07-25T21:56:45Z 2008-07-18T14:16:37Z

Wrocław Non Stop 08, Wytwórnia Filmów Fabularnych (ul. Wystawowa 1) - the video installation by Louis Rollinde - “W.EARTH” - was presented as one of the major events at this year’s Wrocław Non Stop Festival. The installation was inspired by the satellite images from the Google Earth, and Louis Rollinde worked on those still images and transformed them into a set of gigantic installations. In this video, Louis Rollinde leads a quick tour around the installations and talks about the ideas behind the work. The music/sound in this video are performed live on site by Christian Sebille. - N.B. The audio is in French

Download:
w_earth.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 37MB / 7:08)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[The Cinema on Beds]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/the-cinema-on-beds/ 2008-07-19T08:31:27Z 2008-07-13T05:43:41Z Festival of Trailers
11.07.2008-13.07.2008
Trzebnica

The 3rd edition of the Festival of Trailers (Festiwal Zwiastunów) takes place this weekend at Trzebnica, a city just outside of Wrocław. As the name indicates, it is the festival of the short trailer films, but the programme includes also the projections of international documentary films, controversial advertizement and animated films. The projection will take place in the open air cinema and you will be lying on beds to watch the movies. If interested, please be sure to visit www.festiwalzwiastunow.pl (EN/PL) for more information.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Brave Festival 4]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=473 2008-07-14T22:57:51Z 2008-07-03T07:29:24Z Brave Festival 4
Rituals: Out of Africa

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Survival 6]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/survival-6/ 2008-07-14T22:59:35Z 2008-06-28T16:40:12Z Survival 6: Art in Extreme Conditions
29.06.2008-01.07.2008 (Sunday-Tuesday)
Everyday 19:00-01:00
Dzielnica Czterech Świątyń

Every year, “Survival” Art Festival takes art works out of galleries and brings them to the public places, and by doing so, they hope to create productive dynamics with the general public. This year’s edition will take place around the area known as Dzielnica Czterech Świątyń (see the map below). For the details of the programme and exhibitions, please see http://www.survival.art.pl (in EN/PL).

The opening reception will take place at Club Kamfora (ul. Św. Antoniego 24c) on Sunday 29.06 at 19:00.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From the Festival NowoBrzmienia]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=471 2008-06-28T07:21:44Z 2008-06-28T07:05:25Z
On 24.06.2008, KLUB WŁODKOWICA 21 (ul. Włodkowica 21) hosted the festival NowoBrzmienia (see our previous post). In our interview, the organizer Maciek Zakrzewski from Wrocławski Klub FORMATY explains the idea of the festival and introduces the bands featured in this event. For your pleasure, we also included in this video extensive shots from the concerts.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[New Sound Festival]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/new-sound-festival/ 2008-07-19T08:34:03Z 2008-06-19T10:12:39Z 24.06.2008 - 19:00 (Tuesday)
KLUB WŁODKOWICA 21 (ul. Włodkowica 21)
Tickets: 9/5PLN

Wrocławski Klub FORMATY organizes NowoBrzmienia Festival (New Sound Festival) to promote ambitious music based on electronics and styles such as trip-hop, lounge, avant pop and jazz. Feat. Stealpot (Down-tempo/Jazz/Electronica), Fat Burning Step (Dub Step), Zgas, human beatbox (Hip Hop/A’cappella/Rap), Sinusoidal (Electronica/Hip Hop/Psychedelic).

The festival will take place on two stages - this will assure a few hours of non-stop music. The additional attraction will be the monitors to show the bands visualisations during the show. For more info: myspace.com/nowobrzmienia


Stealpot - http://www.myspace.com/stealpot
Down-tempo / Jazz / Electronica

Fat Burning Step - www.myspace.com/bassbond
Dub Step

Zgas, human beatbox - http://www.myspace.com/zgas
Hip Hop / A’cappella / Rap

Sinusoidal - http://www.myspace.com/sinusoidalpoland
Electronica / Hip Hop / Psychedelic



]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[C.Q.F.D #2]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/cqfd-2/ 2008-06-19T10:07:28Z 2008-06-19T09:59:33Z 20.06.2008 – 18:30 (Friday)
ARKA Theatre (ul. Mennicza 3)
Free Admissions
C.Q.F.D (la Culture Qui Fait Discuter) is a series of Francophone round-table discussion organized by Arka Theatre. The June edition invites Toyotaka Ota, video artist and also the founder and the chief editor of WroclawWeekly.pl. He will present WroclawWeekly and its original video publication and also other video works he produced for Polish music groups such as Digit-All-love and L.U.C.
Discussion will be conducted in French & Polish.
Please visit our youtube page for a quick view of the recent videos created by Toyotaka Ota: http://www.youtube.com/WroclawWeekly

————————

Bref sur Toyotaka Ota :
1. WroclawWeekly.pl
Il est le fondateur et le rédacteur de WroclawWeekly.pl. Il filme les évènements dans la ville de Wroclaw et publie les vidéos sur son site. Ces vidéos sont diffusées comme Podcast, et maintenant quelques unes sont aussi disponible sur YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/wroclawweekly
2. visuals
En 2005, il a commencé dans le projet Eklektik Session (http://www.eklektik.art.pl) comme VJ, et ensuite il a été invité à travailler avec un nouveau projet de Maciek Zakrzewski (le compositeur) et Natalia Groszak (la chanteuse de Mikromusic) à la fin de 2005. Et ce projet-ci s’appelle aujourd’hui Digit-All-love (http://www.digit-all-love.com). Ça fait 2 ans et demi qu’ils travaillent ensemble et ils ont joués à Bezsenność, Firlej, Capitol, Impart et vont jouer cet été à l’Opera Wroclawska et aussi à Era Nowe Horyzonty. Le clip qu’il a réalisé est disponible à youtube: http://www.youtube.com/wroclawweekly
En 2007, il est invité à travailler aussi avec L.U.C de Kanał Audytywny (http://www.myspace.com/luksfera) pour son dernier album “Homoxymoronomatura.” 2 vidéos sont disponible à http://www.youtube.com/theonetor
3. web design
par exemple:
http://www.wroclawweekly.pl; http://www.eklektik.art.pl; http://www.alliance.wroclaw.pl
http://www.frankofonia.wroclaw.pl

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Shakespeare Wrocław - “A Midsummer Night’s Dream”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=468 2008-06-15T07:20:01Z 2008-06-15T07:16:11Z
In May 2008, Shakespeare Wrocław performed “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” in the courtyard of Club Pracoffnia (ul. Więzienna 6). Shakespeare Wrocław is an amateur/student theatre group led by the director John White, and they perform each year one Shakespearean play in the original English dialogue (Read more about Shakespeare Wrocław and their performance here). After one of their performance, we interviewed the group and asked them about the choice of this year’s play and the challenge they encountered during the preparation.
Download:
shakespeare2008.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 30.93MB / 5:46)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Miloopa: Unicode Live]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=465 2008-06-07T07:42:19Z 2008-06-07T07:37:14Z
27.04.2008, Club Bezsenność (ul. Ruska 51) - after their a-month-long tour to Germany and UK, Miloopa returned to the Wrocław stage. The concert featured Roli Mosimann, the producer of their 2nd album “Unicode.”
Miloopa is a Wrocław-based Drum’n'Bass unit. Their music, however, is not limited to Drum’n'Bass: Miloopa incorporates many different music forms, such as Jungle, Soul, Downtempo, etc.
Download:
miloopa_unicode.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 11.62MB / 2:14)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Boris - Interview with Atsuo]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=464 2008-05-31T09:24:10Z 2008-05-31T09:16:18Z
The Japanese cult group Boris played a concert at FIRLEJ (ul. Grabiszyńska 56) on 08.05.2008. Before the concert, Jakub Pajek interviewed Atsuo, the drummer/vocalist of the group, in Japanese, and asked him about their work and artistic influences, and also about their new album “Smile.”

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Devil Music Ensemble]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/devil-music-ensemble/ 2008-05-31T07:31:31Z 2008-05-31T07:20:33Z 03.06.2008 - 20:00 (Tuesday)
CRK (ul. Jagiellończyka 10c/d)
Ticket: 5PLN
OPT (Ośrodek Postaw Twórczych) organizes with CRK (Centrum Reanimacji Kultury) an open-air picnic. The main feature of the evening is the projection of the silent movie “Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde” (1920), accompanied by the live performance of Devil Music Ensemble (US) with their original score.

The Devil Music Ensemble, formed in Boston in 1999, is comprised of Brendon Wood on guitars, lap steel, and synthesizer; Jonah Rapino on electric viola, vibraphone, and synthesizer; and Tim Nylander on drums, percussion and synthesizer.
“The Devil Music Ensemble has established itself as one of the primary American groups composing and performing scores for silent films, and can be spoken of in the same breath as groups like the Alloy Orchestra and the Tin Hat Trio.”
Dylan Skolnick - Director of Programming - Cinema Arts Centre

The DME has been on 6 U.S. tours and one European tour playing soundtracks for silent film; performing in museums, theaters, performing arts centers, and college campuses. In late May/early June the DME will be performing at a number of venues in Europe including: Focus Film Theater in Arnhem Netherlands, Filmhuis Lumen in Delft Netherlands, OPT art space in Wroclaw Poland, Panorama Museum in Bad Frankenhausen Germany, UT Connewitz in Leipzig Germany, Pupille Kino an der Uni in Frankfurt Germany, as well as venues in France and Switzerland.

—————–
Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (1920)
Synopsis:
Adolph Zukor presents JOHN BARRYMORE in “Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde” By Robert Louis Stevenson.
Directed by John S. Robertson.
Scenario by Clara S. Beranger.
Photographed by Roy Overbaugh.
Cast: John Barrymore, Brandon Hurst, Martha Mansfield, Charles Lane, Cecil Clovelly, Nita Naldi, J. Malcolm Dunn, George Stevens, Louis Wolheim, & Alma Aiken.
“Dr. Jekyll (John Barrymore) is a London doctor, progressive in his medical research, conservative and repressed in his personal life. A friend encourages him to explore the underside of life with a visit to a London music hall. Dancer Nita Naldi arouses Jekyll’s repressed sensibilities, and when she embraces him, the doctor runs off. Later, Jekyll speculates on the advantage of separating the two natures of man in different bodies- one could “yield to every evil impulse, yet leave the soul untouched.” Jekyll’s scientific passion leads him to a formula that brings out his other side, Mr. Hyde, a man without a conscience.
The initial transformation scene is deservedly famous, achieving its power solely with Barrymore’s expressive features. Visually, Barrymore’s Hyde is not a monster, but the physical result of the effect of a dissolute life. Hyde becomes more decrepit as the film progresses, while Jekyll’s goodness falters. Hyde pursues women, stealing their honor, while his alter ego Jekyll is uncomfortable even with his fiancee. This distinct duality is further developed when Hyde’s depravities get worse and worse, and the two sensibilities begin to become less distinct.
The scenario goes to the essence of the story: the thin line between good and evil in the same person, and the inevitable conflict between the two. On an unconscious level, the film is also about different classes in the same city. The behavior of the working class Hyde is considered strange, but acceptable, until he attacks someone from the upper class (the father of Jekyll’s fiancee). Just as Hyde allowed Jekyll to indulge in forbidden pastimes, the movies allowed Barrymore to indulge his upscale and downscale sensibilities. As a measure of the star’s versatility, while this film was in production during the day at Paramount’s New York studio, John Barrymore was starring as Richard III on Broadway each evening.” —1997 David Pierce
(Taken from the press-release)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mosque Open Day]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/mosque-open-day/ 2008-05-29T07:38:29Z 2008-05-29T07:37:42Z 01.06.2008 - From 11:30 (Sunday)
MUSLIM CENTRE OF CULTURE AND EDUCATION
