]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[A Midsummer Night’s Dream]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/a-midsummer-nights-dream/ 2008-05-27T10:17:39Z 2008-05-27T10:16:07Z

30.05.2008 - 01.06.2008 (Friday - Sunday)
CLUB PRACOFFNIA (ul. Więzienna 6)
Starts Everyday at 16:00
Free Admissions
A student theatre group, under the direction of John White, presents the performance of William Shakespeare’s A Midsummer Night’s Dream in English. John White works as English teacher, but he is also a theatre actor/director. At the beginning of the academic year, he organizes a group with students who are interested in working with Shakespeare’s original texts, or simply in acting, and prepares a performance for the end of the year. The previous performance took place in 2006 and the group presented the comedy “The Merry Wives of Windsor” (see our video coverage: Shakespeare Wrocław).

Actors:
John White - English teacher and the director of this performance
Jacek Adamiak - student of Wyższa Szkoła Bankowa we Wrocławiu
Paul Boisvert - English teacher from Canada
Virgil Haden-Pawłowski - English teacher from Canada
Tuba Aydinoglu - from Turkey, studies at the English Philology, University of Wrocław
Judyta Wnonko - student of the English Philology, University of Wrocław
Marta Wojczuk - studies in a secondary school

About the Play:
William Shakespeare’s A Midsummer Night’s Dream (”The Lovers”) tells the story of four lovers who elope into the forest to escape a forced marriage brought on by Athenian law. There they are met by trickster fairies who live in the woods and who, using a magic love flower, lead the lovers astray in a long night of jealousy and misunderstandings. When they awake in the morning they have come to a new appreciation of each other’s love.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Ciacho w Mleczarni]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=460 2008-05-23T11:28:49Z 2008-05-23T11:23:13Z
On 18.05.2008 at Café Mleczarnia (ul. Włodkowica 5), the exhibition by Anka Mierzejewska - “Ciacho w Mleczarni” – opened the 2-week long festival “Czyli Wrocław,” the first cultural initiative by Mleczarnia Foundation. The exhibition title “Ciacho w Mleczarni” is here given a double meaning: one is literally “cake (ciastko) in Mleczarnia” - making a reference to Mleczarnia as café - and the second meaning is from the Polish slang “Ciacho” - “someone hot, attractive.” In the video interview, Asia Męczyńska, the organizer of the event, and the artist Anka Mierzejewska talk about the idea of the exhibition, the place and the paintings.
Festival “Czyli Wrocław” continues this coming week from 27.05 through 29.05.2008. For more information, check this link.

Download: ciacho_w_mle.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 14.11MB / 2:41)
Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Exodust]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/exodust/ 2008-05-22T16:49:32Z 2008-05-22T16:46:21Z 25.05.2008 – 19:15 (Sunday)
WSPÓŁCZESNY (CONTEMPORARY) THEATRE
(ul. Rzeźnicza 12)
Tickets: 30/20PLN
Dance Performance
A French dance group “Melting Spot,” led by the French hip-hop dance pioneer Farid Berki, presents a contemporary dance performance: “Exodust.” As the title indicates, the performance elaborates on the theme of “migration,” and more specifically, on “illegal immigrants,” their hope, difficulty and disappointment in a society today.



choreography & artistic direction: Farid Berki
dancers: Yiphun Chiem, Gérard Gourdot, Johnny Martinage, Mani Mungai

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Czyli Wrocław - Artistic Festival]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=458 2008-07-15T04:54:14Z 2008-05-13T12:27:10Z 18.05-21.05.2008 & 27.05-29.05.2008
MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)

Mleczarnia Foundation organizes the 1st edition of “Czyli Wrocław.” “Czyli Wrocław” literally translates as “Or Wrocław” or “A.k.a. Wrocław,” and this title reflects the ambition of the festival to represent a dynamic and creative side of Wrocław and promote it to a wider public both in and out of the city. The programme includes theatre performance, discussion meeting, concert and cabaret, etc.

PROGRAMME:

 18.05.2008 - 20:00 (Sunday) 
Free Admission
The opening of the exhibition of paintings - “Ciacho w Mleczarni” - by Anka Mierzejewska
The exhibition is open till 15.06.2008

 19.05.2008 - 20:00 (Monday) 
Tickets: 25/20PLN
Presentation of a play “Zabawy pod kocykiem” by [:]sceny witkacego.wro, one of the most avant-garde theatre group in Wrocław today.
“Zabawy pod kocykiem” tells a history of Poland from 1939 up to today seen by an apple-tree, a mushroom, a beetroot, an eagle and a hen.
———
Zabawy pod kocykiem
written by: Andreas Pilgrim & Sebastian Majewski
director: Sebastian Majewski
scenography: Joanna Howańska
music: Marcin Juraszek

 20.05.2008 - 19:00 (Tuesday) 
Tickets: 25/20PLN
Presentation of a play “Na zachód od Sao Paulo” by [:]sceny witkacego.wro
The play recounts a story of Erica Strass, a woman who lived in Wrocław between 1938 and 1971. With her, we walk through a history of the city of Wrocław from behind the scene.

 21.05.2008 - 19:00 (Wednesday) 
Jak Ja TO ROBIĘ? (How do I do it?)
Free Admission
Presentation and discussion by Magdalena Grobelna
Magdalena Grobelna is a graduate of the Academy of Fine Art in Wrocław and, among many things, works as a graphic artist, a designer and a theatre scenographer.

 27.05.2008 - 20:00 (Tuesday) 
Tickets: 25/20PLN
Ethno-music concert by Sambor Dudziński
Sambor Dudziński is a multiinstrumentalist, a composer and an actor.

 28.05.2008 - 19:00 (Wednesday) 
Tickets: 30/25PLN
“Kabaret Olbrzymów” - a cabaret theatre performance by Teatr Cinema from Michałowice
Directed by Zbyszek Szumski

 29.05.2008 - 19:00 (Thursday) 
Tickets: 20/15PLN
“Dialogi na ręce i nogi” No2
A performance by Teatr Tańca Arka. As the name of the theatre indicates, their performance is a mix of theatre and dance (”tańca”), and their narrative is built and, at the same time, communicated by their carefully choreographed bodily movements.
Cast: Jacek Gębura, Tomasz Leszczyński, Katarzyna Torzyńska, Paweł Romańczuk

Tickets are available at the reception of Hostel Mleczarnia from 14.05 (Wednesday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mandala 2008: Interview with Sharon Feder]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=456 2008-05-20T08:11:27Z 2008-05-10T08:19:53Z
At the Mandala Performance Festival (25.04.2008 – 27.04.2008), a Canadian actress Sharon Feder presented a performance entitled “Nostalgia”
In the interview after the performance, Feder shared with us some of the personal motivations behind the creation of this piece.
Before the camera, she talks about her family history, homesickness, reflection on plural identities and also the significance of “Wrocław” in all of this.
For more information about Sharon Feder and her works, please visit: www.soundmoves.ca
Sharon Feder’s performance took place on 26.04.2008 at Galeria Miejska (ul. Kiełbaśnicza 28).

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Form Theatre: “Only You”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/form-theatre-only-you/ 2008-05-09T10:38:30Z 2008-05-09T10:37:53Z Mime Performance:
“Only You – Farce Of One Couple”
11.05.2008 - 19:30 (Sunday)
FORM THEATRE – MIME STAGE
(ul. Hallera 15 / building of Cinema Lwow)
Tickets: 25PLN (20PLN for students)
This wordless performance recounts a story of a hard, sometime absurd, but possible love. The story, whose initial scene opens to the Poland in the early 1930’s, covers the period of a little less than 60 years. It is a story that comes back from the memory, almost like a dream, and some of the events are almost a dream themselves.

directing and music arrangement
Józef Markocki
cast
Ewelina Ciszewska, Józef Markocki,
Grzegorz Szymczyk

runtime - 60 min
contact:
www.pantomima.pl ,
teatrformy@pantomima.pl, tel+48 669902048


]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[SIMCHA X - Jewish Culture Fesitval11.05.2008-15.05.2008]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/simcha-x-jewish-culture-fesitval11052008-15052008/ 2008-05-08T09:03:36Z 2008-05-08T08:52:54Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Wotienke & Band]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/wotienke-band/ 2008-05-01T08:53:40Z 2008-05-01T08:52:00Z 07.05.2008 - 20:30 (Wednesday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Boris + Growing]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=451 2008-05-06T15:35:32Z 2008-05-01T08:39:25Z 08.05.2008 - 20:00 (Thursday)
FIRLEJ (ul. Grabiszyńska 56)
Tickets: 45/35PLN
Psychedelic / Alternative / Noise / Doom etc.
Japanese experimental band “Boris” returns to Wrocław at the occasion of the release of their new album “Smile.” For more info: www.inoxia-rec.com/boris. The concert features also a US duo Growing.
Read on for the interview with Atsuo, the drummer and the vocalist of Boris // The questions are by Bartek Gil and the interview is published here by the courtesy of PopUp [www.popupmusic.pl - the Polish version]

Bartek Gil: Where do you think acid/psychodelic music re-gains its strength from?
Atsuo: いろいろな過去音源の発掘作業も充実してるからね。みんな未来に絶望してる風潮もあると思う。だから過去に夢を見ようとしている。過去の方が捏造（批評）することに、あまり責任を問われないし、危険の伴わない謎解きをしているように感じる。未来を作って行く方が危険で、やっぱり意義のあることだと思うんだが。
[Well, a lot of audio materials from the past have been restored and are readily accessible today. And also there is this hopelessness that everyone seems to feel about the future. That’s why everyone tries to find dream in the past. There is much less responsibility in fabricating (criticizing) the past, and it feels like solving puzzles without taking any risk. It is more risky to move towards future, but I think it would be more meaningful...]

Q. it used to be popular ages ago and apparently it seems now it’s attractive to people who seek for more contemporary commentary and interpretation of reality. Would you say it’s blossoming now or it’s just that it’s being hyped at the moment?
現在はいろいろな価値観が共存しているし、サイケデリックのムーブメントはあの６０年代後半の未開な文化の状態であったからこそ熱病のように世界中に広がったんだろう。それは音楽というよりは現象であったろうと思うし、今の時代はパソコンの画面の中で”経験すること無く”物事が進行して行く。そんな時代への憧れもあるんだろうね。
[I think the psychedelic movement spread all over the world like a fever only because of that wild, untamed period that the end of the 60’s was. It was more like a cultural phenomenon and not simply about music. But today many different values and tastes coexist, and things happen in the computer screen “without actually experiencing them.” It may be that people feel a certain longing for that period.]

Q. (by the way - do you yourself have an interest in contemporary music? who would you call a cutting-egde artist?)
そういった意味で、今自分たちは”音楽”をやるつもりは全くない。音楽には興味が無い。音楽というジャンルにいながら”経験”を促すきっかけを作るようなことをBorisはやるようになってきている。自覚的、コンセプチュアルにやっている訳でなく、面白いことを求めて行ったらこういうことになって行ったね。
だからSunn o)))とかはやはり経験そのものだし、すごく刺激になるし、影響も受けてるね。
[We have now no intention of making “music” in that sense. We have no interest in music at all. Boris has been doing things that could help setting off the “experience” without leaving the music as a genre. But we are not doing that self-consciously or conceptually. It just happened this way when we pursued what interested us.
So, in that sense, we get inspiration from the bands like Sunn o))), for example, which is a pure experience, and we also get some influences from them.]

Q. How spontaneous you are when it comes to recording? It seems that not necessarily every sound appearing on an album is deeply thought-out and you prefer recording live to overdub. If it’s right, does it come more from pre-recording assumptions or your general attitute about creative process?
”Smile”のレコーディングではどちらの側面もあったね。自然体、つまりインプロビゼーションを主体に、記録された素材を曲にして行く（自然に聴こえなくしていく）やり方。パズルのようにリフを組み合わせつつ、そのあとのアクシデントと出会わせるやり方。結局は”混沌と秩序”そのどちらかに偏ること自体がつまらない。混沌と秩序をひとつの作品のなかに共存させることが、僕らにとってスリリングな音として経験できるものだな
[The recording of “Smile” had both. We create a tune from recorded materials on the basis of spontaneity – or, improvisation – and make it less natural and spontaneous as we go along. While we combine riffs like a puzzle, we also break it down. In the end, it is boring if we must choose between “chaos and the order.” To make “chaos and the order” coexist in one work – that’s the thing that we can “experience” as exciting sound.]

Q. Your discography is impressive. One can have an impression that incessant stream of consciousness and need of communication is crucial for the band. Where would you place it on your ladder of values (especially when you were to confront it with formal limitations)?
制限は無いんだよね。いつも。レーベルからいつまでに！ってデッドラインが決められることはないし。
レコーディングも自分達でやってるから、コストも他のバンドに比べてすごく低いと思うよ。
だからレコーディング時間の制約も無い。
それで、「incessant stream of consciousness」ってのは実は誰でも本当は持ってるものだと思うんだよね。世間一般的に「日常は退屈なもの」とかそういうことになってるだけで。目の前の現実に目を向けたらそこにはスリリングな日常が本当はあって、そうしたら意識はドライブせざるを得ないと思うんだけど。僕らは普通のことを普通にやってるとおもうよ。
それとコミュニケーションの本質は「わからないこと」だと思ってる。理解し合うことがコミュニケーションではない。わからないまま、もやもやした気持ちも抱えながら、保留の状態で進むこともすごく大切なことだと思うんだ。バンドの中ではそれほど言葉によるコミュニケーションに重きを置いてないし、制作の過程の中では音に耳を傾ける時間、その音が世界にどう響いていくのか感じること重要になってくる。
[There is no formal limitation. We don’t have a deadline from a label. Because we record by ourselves, I think the cost is much lower than other bands, and that’s why there is no limit to the recording time, either.
We think that “incessant stream of consciousness” is something that everyone has. It’s just that people already decided that “everyday life is boring,” but I think if you take a close look at the reality in front of us, you’ll see an exciting life and your mind will just get going. I just feel that we are not doing anything more than that ordinary thing.
By the way, I think the essence of communication is “not to understand.” Understanding one another is not a communication. I think it is important to continue even in suspension, without understanding and with some unresolved feeling. In our band, the communication with words is not that important, and in the creative process, it is more important to pay attention to the sound and feel what impression that sound is going to leave in the world.]

Q. As this is an interview for an on-line magazine and your albums are often limited to a few thousands copies what do you think would/can make people realize that it’s not the more CDs you rip off the more cool you are?
お？これは僕らの音源が「rip off」と言われてるってこと？（笑）リリースの枚数が限定になるのは、僕らのアイデアがコストがかかりすぎるし、一般的な製造ラインには無いことが多い。だから限定になってしまうんだけど。でも見たいものは見たい。作り手の強靭な欲求がなければ、それを買ってくれる人にも「新しい経験」は訪れないと思ってる。そういう意味でも、ぼくらは自分達の経験という快楽を追求するよ。
あとはそれが買ってくれた人にとって「良い経験」となることを願うのみ。だね。誠実に、ひとつづつまじめにコツコツやってくしかない。今までもそうやってきたし、これからも変わらない
[Are you referring to the fact that people are calling our audio sources a “rip off”? (laugh) The number of our albums is limited, because our ideas cost too much and often not commonly available. That’s why the release gets limited, but still we want to do what we want to do. If we don’t have a strong enough will to pursue what we want to do, I think the people who buy our albums won’t get any “new experience.” In that sense, we will continue to explore the pleasure called our own experience.
We just hope that this will be a “good experience” for people who buy. All we can do is to work sincerely, and one step at a time. We did it like that until now, and that won’t change.]

Q. You play with growing and shellac on this tour. what are these bands to you?
Growingはアメリカでも一緒にツアーもやったりしていて、個人的にいろいろ共感できる部分が多い。
そのことを彼らと話したことはないけど、言葉でわかり合う以上に、一緒に”同じ空間”に居られるってことが重要だな、って思うし。すごい感じのいい奴らだし、彼らの音ももちろん好き。
[With Growing, we also toured together in U.S.A. and personally there are a lot of things that I feel close to. I’ve never told them, but the fact that we share the “same space” matters to me, much more than understanding one another with words. They are nice guys and, of course, I like their sound as well.]

Q. do you feel any kin towards (ex)kranky bands and is steve albini’s attitute appealing to you anyhow?
Rapemanは大好きなバンドだったな。最悪な名前だけど。最悪な名前は日本の漫画からってことも知ってるけど。彼の録音方法は僕らのそれとは対極にあると感じるね。
[Rapeman was a band I liked a lot, although it had a terrible name. And I also know that they took this terrible name from a Japanese manga. I feel that the way he records is exactly opposite to ours.]

Q. Your famed jumps over your drum kit, stage diving and crowdsufring are more an effect of dealing with real emotions or rather a result of awareness that people expect a bit of spectacular show from such a conceptual band.
「いやいや、そんなの嘘の感情で、演出、お約束に決まってるじゃん。」って言った方が期待に添えるのかな？（笑）それとも「ライブ中は感情が昂って、訳が分からなくなってどうしてもあんな風になってしまうんだ。」って言う方がいい？
この二つは僕にとってどちらも本当で、どちらも嘘。ただ、ショウを「オーディエンスと一緒に楽しみたい」とはいつも思ってるよ。
また次回会場で会えることを楽しみにしてる。
[Would you like me to say: “No, no, of course all the emotion is a fake and it’s all just a performance”? (laugh). Or, do you prefer: “During the live concert, I get all excited and things just happen that way”?
For me, both of them are true, and both of them are just a lie. But I always want to enjoy the show with the public and that feeling is true.
I’m looking forward to seeing you again at a concert.]

// Translated from Japanese to English by Toyotaka Ota [WroclawWeekly.pl]

25.04.2008 – 19:00 (Friday)
ARKA Theatre (ul. Mennicza 3)
During the Journées de la Francophonie (07.03-16.03.2008), the round-table discussion on the theme of “La perte d’influence de la culture française?” took place with the initiative of Arka Theatre (the audio recording of the discussion is available here).
Arka Theatre is extending the scope and organizing a monthly discussion meeting on contemporary Francophone/French culture. The 1st meeting in the series invites Sharon Feder, a Canadian actrice, who is in Wrocław at the occasion of Mandala Performance Festival (her performance will be programmed on Saturday 26.04.2008 at 16:00, at GALERIA MIEJSKA [ul. Kiełbaśnicza 28] - for more details on the festival, please see our previous post)

This is already its 4th edition, and the festival continues its unique and atypical programming. This year’s programme includes: “non-dance” dance, butoh, action painting, body art.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Wrocław Chamber Orchestra “Leopoldinum”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/wroclaw-chamber-orchestra-%e2%80%9cleopoldinum%e2%80%9d/ 2008-04-10T08:46:50Z 2008-04-10T08:45:08Z 13.04.2008 – 18:00 (Sunday)
AULA LEOPOLDINA (pl. Uniwersytecki 1)
Tickets: 25/15PLN
Under the direction of Mariusz Smolij, Wrocław Chamber Orchestra “Leopoldinum”will play the compositions by Andrzej Panufnik, Aaron Copland, Anton Arensky and Joseph Haydn.

“Compositions of Arensky, who tutored such famous composers like Rimsky-Korsakov, Rakhmaninov and Scriabin among others, are not very well known, and his Variations on a theme of P. Tchaikovsky will be performed for the first time by the Leopoldinum orchestra. Igor Cecocho, trumpet soloist of the concert, will perform Andrzej Panufnik’s Concerto in modo antico. This piece was successfully recorded by both artists – Mariusz Smolij and Igor Cecocho for the firm Naxos (with the Polish Chamber Orchestra) in 2006.
Quiet City was originally composed by Aaron Copland as theater music for the Irvin Shaw’s play. But in this form was performed for two weeks only, later on (since 1941) only in the concert version. Two soloists will perform Quiet City: Igor Cecocho, trumpet and Waldemar Korpak, cor anglais.
Haydn’s symphony La Passione will conclude the program.” (From the press release)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2008 - Tales of Perrault]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=443 2008-04-07T11:11:35Z 2008-04-07T11:10:07Z
 
This is the last podcast episode from this year’s Journées de la Francophonie (07.03-16.03.2008) in Wrocław.
Arka Theatre presented a theatrical adaptation of 2 of the most famous tales by Charles Perrault: “Le Petit Chaperon rouge (Little Red Riding Hood)” and “Les Fées (Diamonds and Toads).” The play was made primarily for children, but, just like the original stories by Perrault, it was just as enjoyable for the grown-ups. In our interview, the actor Alexandre Marquézy briefly explains the idea behind this adaptation.

Download: francophonie08_05.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 15.73MB / 3:01)
Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Early German Harpsichord]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=442 2008-03-31T05:57:34Z 2008-03-31T05:56:24Z
 
On 29.30.2008 at Ossolineum Hall - this evening’s concert was organized with the heading: “Early German Harpsichord.” In this video, you will see the fragments of a performance of the compositions by Georg Bochm (1661-1733) & Heinrich Ignaz Franz von Biber (1644-1704). Performing are Urszula Danielewicz (harpsichord), John Ma (violin) & Myriam Rignol (viola da gamba).
This concert was presented as part of the 4th-annual Harpsichord Music Days (26.03-30.03.2008), organized by Ars&Studium.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Music / Radio / Experiment]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/music-radio-experiment/ 2008-03-31T05:19:40Z 2008-03-31T05:19:40Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Lacrimosa: Anthropological Version]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/lacrimosa-anthropological-version/ 2008-03-31T05:22:23Z 2008-03-27T11:05:15Z 02 & 03.04.2008 - 20:00 (Wednesday & Thursday)
PIEŚŃ KOZŁA THEATRE (ul. Purkyniego 1)
Tickets: 30PLN (Group Discount: 25PLN)
The presentation of the anthropological version of the performance: “Lacrimosa.”
The evening will be divided in three parts.

First part (IMPRESSION): the film showing the Anastenaria – the ritual of fire walking that inspired the movement aspect of the performance. The movie was recorded in Greece in 2003.

Second part (IMPROVISATION): the training session, in which the actors improvise upon the movement aspect observed during the ritual of Anastenaria. The training also illustrates the unique technique of coordination, used by the practitioners of Pieśń Kozła Theatre in their work with students and preparation of new performances.

Third part (STRUCTURE): the performance “Lacrimosa” as a result of both impression and improvisation on the theme.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Polish-Russian Short Films]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/polish-russian-short-films/ 2008-03-27T11:00:14Z 2008-03-27T11:00:14Z 30.03.2008 - 20:00 (Sunday)

On 15.03.2008, the concert of Nosfell took place as part of this year’s Journées de la Francophonie (07.03-16.03.2008) at Firlej. On stage, Nosfell put together simple audio-visual elements - light, voice, movement, etc. - and channelled them into a surprising harmony.

This year’s programme presents the harpsichord from various perspectives, and each concert will be a unique musical experience.

Programme:

26.03.2008 - 19:00 (Wednesday)

The Roentgen Connection
Gośka Isphording - harpsichord, Karolina Bäter - flute

Tickets: 18/13PLN (Family: 30PLN)
Marek Niewiedział - oboe, Zbigniew Pilch - violin, Przemysław Raczek - viola, Jarosław Thiel - cello, Marta Niedźwiecka - harpsichord

The ballet company “Cracovia Danza”

OSSOLINEUM HALL (ul. Szewska 37)
Tickets: 18/13PLN (Family: 30PLN)
Urszula Danielewicz - harpsichord, John Ma - violin, Myriam Rignol - viola da gamba

 Brandenburg Harpsichord 
30.03.2008 - 19:00 (Sunday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2008 - Sayag Jazz Machine]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=435 2008-03-16T13:51:11Z 2008-03-16T13:50:37Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2008 - A’Corps]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=434 2008-03-12T11:20:40Z 2008-03-12T11:20:35Z
 
11.03.2008, Teatr Lalek - A’Corps dance company performed a piece entitled “Nous sommes tous…” for the general public. It was the second performance, following the one at the opening ceremony of Journées de la Francophonie the night before. The performance was offered for free, and many young people took advantage of the occasion.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Francophonie 2008 - Davy Sicard]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=433 2008-03-10T07:35:58Z 2008-03-09T22:03:49Z
 
The first video podcast from this year’s Journées de la Francophonie (07.03-16.03.2008) presents the concert by Davy Sicard (08.03.2008 at Jazz Club Rura).
The singer Davy Sicard was born in the Réunion Island and is currently living in France. He sang in the mixture of Réunionnaise Creole and French, and, although the lyrics reflected his personal voice, just like the language in which they were sung, the history and the culture of the Réunion Island were also visibly present in many different ways (for example, the selection of themes and topics, words, or stories). “Journées de la Francophonie” is a celebration of the diversity of people who speak French and their culture, and the concert of Davy Sicard could not have been more appropriate as an opening act for the festival.

Download: francophonie08_01.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 21.37MB / 4:01)
Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Journées de la Francophonie 2008]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/journees-de-la-francophonie-2008/ 2008-03-07T05:50:47Z 2008-03-06T12:45:00Z 07.03.2008-16.03.2008
Commemorating the establishment of the intergovernmental organization of “Francophones,” the festival “Journées de la Francophonie” organizes various cultural events, exhibitions and a series of conferences every year. For this year’s programme, please visit http://frankofonia.wroclaw.pl/ (in French and Polish).
On Friday 07.03.2008, as a part of the festival, a round-table discussion on the current cultural relationship between France and Poland – and Wrocław in particular – will be held at Alliance Francaise (Biblioteka Wojdwodska, Rynek 58 3rd Floor). The discussion will be in French and start at 18:00. Free admissions.
Click here to see our video podcast coverage of the last year’s Journées de la Francophonie

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Chameleon Jazz]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/chameleon-jazz/ 2008-03-05T06:48:56Z 2008-03-05T06:46:57Z 06.03.2008 - 20:00 (Thursday)
MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
Tickets: 30/25PLN
A jazz concert by *Trzaska/Gasser/Zerang*
feat. Mikołaj Trzaska — sax, bass clarinet, klarnet basowy
Clementine Gasser– violoncello
Michalel Zerang — percussions
This is a new jazz project led by Mikołaj Trzaska. The collaboration of three musicians with different musical background creates an interesting mix of classical music, free-style jazz and etho-folk music.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Matplaneta on Tour]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/matplaneta-on-tour/ 2008-03-05T05:44:25Z 2008-03-05T05:41:46Z Matplaneta & 100nka are on tour this month. Here is the schedule:
07.03.08 Warszawa “Café Culturalna”
08.03.08 Bydgoszcz “Mózg”
09.03.08 Torun “Pod Aniołem”
14.03.08 Świnoujście “Centrala”
18.03.08 Kraków “Alchemia”
17.03.08 Katowice “Cogitatur”
19.03.08 Wrocław “Mleczarnia”
Matplaneta’s music combines the electronic tones from 70’ and trance and jazz, and goes in the line of the new stream of Polish electro-acoustic music scene, along with other renowned Polish bands as such “Skalpel,” “Robotobibok,” and “Pink Freud.”
Matplaneta are:
Marcel Arp – electric piano, analog synthesizers
Ju-ghan – double bass, bass guitar
Tomasz M. - drums

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Bertolt Brecht’s BAAL]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/bertolt-brecht%e2%80%99s-baal/ 2008-01-24T08:07:36Z 2008-01-24T08:07:36Z 26.01.2008 – 19:15 (Saturday)
Współczesny (Contemporary) Theatre
(ul. Rzeźnicza 12)
This Saturday the Wrocław Współczesny Theatre premieres a new production of “BAAL” by Bertolt Brecht, directed by Anna Augustynowicz. “BAAL” was written in 1918, when Brecht was only 20 years old. This play is a satirical and lyrical rendition of a realist observation of human conditions.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays S2E04 - La Forza Gentile]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=415 2008-01-04T09:28:44Z 2008-01-04T09:16:52Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Apoptosis]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/apoptosis/ 2007-12-27T10:10:32Z 2007-12-27T10:08:30Z 29.12.2007 - 19:00 (Saturday)
Scena Kalambur (ul. Kuźnicza 29a)
Free admission
A Butoh spectacle by Teatr Limen (Warsaw). The title word “Apoptosis” means “programmed death of cells,” and this spectacle attempts to choreograph a thinking of hidden cellular decay, its inevitability and the preparation for death. Preceding the performance, Sylwia Hanff from Teatr Limen also organizes a Butoh workshop on Friday, 28.12.2007 at PANTOGRAF (pl. Strzelecki 17/1, Free admission). For more information about the workshop, please contact: art16@tlen.pl
You can view the video recording from the last presentation of “Apoptosis” in Wrocław here

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Elvis & Cowboys in Karpacz]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/elvis-cowboys-in-karpacz/ 2007-12-06T09:05:14Z 2007-12-06T09:02:57Z 14.12.2007 - 18:30 (Friday)
WESTERN CITY (Cowboy Ranch in Karpacz)
BlueBird Productions organizes a pre-Xmas treat in the mountain. “The Soul of Elvis” - a group from Berlin - will perform a Elvis show at the cowboy ranch in Karpacz. The evening will include dinner and dancing, and the night stay and the transport from Wrocław can be also arranged upon request. For more information, please contact: 695805553 or 697800557

The ticket pricing & options:
* 125PLN/35EU/single entry - full course dinner, Elvis show other extra features.
* 450PLN/125EU/couple - full course dinner, Elvis show, extras, room and breakfast in a Karpacz hotel.
* 50PLN/14EU - RT transfer from Wrocław (Centrum, Galerie Dominikańska, Bielany pick up) to Karpacz.

Tickets are available at EMPIK, Mediamarkt, Dolnośląskie Centrum, Informacji Kulturalnej in Wrocław and Sklep muzyczny.

BlueBird Productions was founded by two Americans who have settled in Poland and share the vision to bring to Poland unique and memorable entertainment experiences. Future events will have a wide range of themes such as musical concerts, classical dances, art and wine tasting, Theatrical performances etc.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Greek Orthodox Cantors]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/greek-orthodox-cantors/ 2007-11-27T13:22:16Z 2007-11-27T13:21:40Z 01.12.2007 - 18:00 (Saturday)
ORTHODOX CHURCH OF SS. CYRIL & METHODIUS
(Cerkiew Cyryla i Metodego / ul. Jadwigi 15)
Free admission
Lycourgos Angelopoulos is the first cantor of Athens’s cathedral and is known as the authority in orthodox Byzantine chant. This Saturday, he will sing with three of his chorists.

30.11.2007 - 18:00 (Friday)
01.12.2007 - 10:00 (Saturday)
Admission charge for the seminar is 20 PLN.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Catherine Breillat Retrospective]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=404 2007-11-26T06:58:21Z 2007-11-26T06:58:17Z 26.11.2007-06.12.2007
ATOM CINEMA (ul. Piłsudskiego 74, tel. 071/ 347-14-65)
ATOM Cinema proposes a retrospective on the works of a French film-maker Catherine Breillat. Breillat’s films are known for their controversial treatment of eroticism and sexuality and they are often experimental to achieve intended effects. The full-programme:
Une vraie jeune fille (1976) - Monday 26.11.2007 - 17:00 & 20:30
Tapage nocturn (1979) - Tuesday 27.11.2007 - 17:00 & 20:30
36 fillette (1988) - Wednesday 28.11.2007 - 17:00 & 20:30
La sale comme un ange (1992)- Thursday 29.11.2007 - 17:00 & 20:30
Breve traversee (2001) - Friday 30.11.2007 - 17:45 & 21:00
Une vieille maitresse (2007) - Saturday 01.12.2007 - 17:30 & 21:00
Sex is comedy (2002) - Sunday 02.12.2007 - 17:30 & 21:00
Parfait amour (1996) - Monday 03.12.2007 - 17:00 & 20:30
Romance (1999) - Tuesday 04.12.2007 - 18:00 & 21:00
À ma soeur (2000) - Wednesday 05.12.2007 - 18:00 & 21:00
Anatomie de l’enfer (2004) - Thursday 06.12.2007 - 18:00 & 21:00

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[“Ofensywa młodych” - Teens on Stage]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/ofensywa-mlodych-teens-on-stage/ 2007-11-21T11:09:49Z 2007-11-21T10:40:08Z  PrzeglądARKA: A Review of Talents, Ideas and Possibilities, Part 2 
23.11.2007 – 19:00 (Friday)
ARKA Theatre (ul. Mennicza 3)
Tickets: 5PLN
Seat availability limited
Book tickets at 071 344 3806 from 10am to 4pm
or by e-mail: teatr@teatrarka.pl
Following up with the first installation of PrzeglądARKA series - “Trans-misja” - last month, ARKA Theatre present this week a series of performances by teenagers under the title “Ofensywa młodych.” ARKA Theatre organizes performing art workshops for teenagers throughout the year, and the performances in this programme are the result of the work in 2006/07.

Programme:
• Pantomime “Franek” (prepared with Ewelina Niewiadowska)
• Cabaret “Poczekalnia” (by Sylwester Różycki) with: Katarzyna Mierzejewska & Dominika Śniegocka, Justyna Gumienna & Michał Gronowski
• Monodrame by Dominika Śniegocka - “Ćma” a fragment from “Milczenia owiec (The Silence of the Lambs)” by Thomas Harris
• Monodrame by Aleksandra Książek - “Pieśń o miłości” a fragment from “Domu duchów (La casa de los espíritus)” by Isabelle Allende
• Monodrame “Opium” by the idea of Agnieszka Sinicka (directed by Artur Borkowski)


(photo. Andrzej Nowak)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Wacław Mikłaszewski at Capitol]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/waclaw-miklaszewski-at-capitol/ 2007-11-20T10:29:30Z 2007-11-20T09:28:21Z Wacław Mikłaszewski in Concert
25.11.2007 – 19:00 (Sunday)
CAPITOL THEATRE (ul. Piłsudskiego 67)
Ticket: 25/15PLN
The Grand Prix winner of this year’s Przegląd Piosenki Aktorskiej (Singing Actors’ Festival, a.k.a. PPA) returns with new materials to the PPA’s home theatre Capitol, after an inspirational travelling around the world (USA & Japan). His songs take inspiration from the impressions and rhythm of the streets and human emotion between morning coffee and French croissants.
The audio sample here: may_i_ask.mp3
For more information: www.youmewe.eu

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays S2E03]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=400 2007-11-19T16:57:26Z 2007-11-19T16:56:46Z
 
29.10.2007, MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5) — the second exhibition of this year’s “Enjoy Mondays” (“Polubisz Poniedziałki”) festival presented the graphic works by Adrianna Konopniak–Kaprowicz, with the title: “Faktura, struktura, skrzydło, papierowy neobarok (Invoice, Structure, Wing, Paper Neobaroque)”.
Apart from the usual exhibition inside Mleczarnia, there was also an exhibition of graphic works contained in ice sculpture just outside its entrance. The opening reception was accompanied by a short violin concert.

Live Music: Job Karma, Schloss Tegal

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[La Luz Unplugged]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/la-luz-unplugged/ 2007-11-19T07:44:58Z 2007-11-19T07:43:47Z Every Wednesday, from 21.11.2007 till 12.12.2007, La Luz (ul. Krainskiego 14) hosts a series of standard-jazz concerts by the local musicians. This week, “La Luz Unplugged” starts with
MARCELINA STOSZEK TRIO
Marcelina Stoszek - vocals
Dawid Korbaczynski - guitar
Sławomir Dudar - sax
Former Majahba vocalist Marcelina just launched a new project - Mariija - with guitarist Dawid Korbaczynski (from Mikromusic). On this concert, the same duo with Dudar (from a jazz trio Not Only…) plays jazz standards.
21.11.2007 - 19:30 (Wednesday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Leopoldinum Plays Andrzej Panufnik]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=390 2007-11-17T17:04:36Z 2007-11-17T17:04:28Z 25.11.2007 - 18:00 (Sunday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Bobo Stenson – Solo Concert]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/bobo-stenson-%e2%80%93-solo-concert/ 2007-11-14T06:29:24Z 2007-11-14T06:28:45Z
19.11.2007 - 19:30 (Monday)
GOTHIC HALL (Sala gotycka, ul. Purkyniego 1)
Ticket: 150PLN
Pianist Bobo Stenson, an ECM artist, is one of the most sought-after Swedish jazz musicians in the world. He has played with Jan Garbarek, Charles Lloyd, Don Cherry and is one of the few artists whose music can be found on ECM’s series ‘Rarum’ - the best recordings of the label. In the ‘90s Stenson performed regulary with the well-known Polish trumpet player Tomasz Stanko and participated in many international projects and festivals.
Bobo Stenson was awarded the European Jazz Prize in December 2006 in Vienna.
from the press release / photo: Jerzy Pajewski
Bobo Stenson will also play in Poznań on 20.11.2007 (Tuesday) at 19:30, at Muzyczna Waga (Waga Miejska, Stary Rynek 2).
Tickets are available at:
Wrocław - OKiS (Rynek, Ratusz 24), Kasa 22 (Dworzec Główny PKP)
Poznań - Muzyczna Waga, Centrum Informacji Miejskiej, Sklep muzyczny FRIPP, www.bilety24.pl

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays S2E02 - La Musique Galante]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=396 2007-11-11T19:35:17Z 2007-11-11T19:33:19Z
 
On Monday 22.10.2007, at the refectory of Ossolineum (ul. Szewska 37), Zbigniew Pilch (violin) and Marta Niedźwiecka (harpsichord) played selected 18th-century compositions (please see the full programme for the details). This concert was presented as part of the “Enjoy Mondays” (“Polubisz Poniedziałki”) festival.
The second concert of the festival - “La Forza Gentile: Quintessence of Taste” - with a wind-instrument quintet will take place on Monday 12.11.2007, 19:00, at the same refectory of Ossolineum.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Close to Jazz]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/close-to-jazz/ 2007-11-08T08:16:13Z 2007-11-08T08:15:00Z “Blisko Jazzu” - A Photo Exhibition
10.11.2007 - 19:00 (Saturday)
FORMATY (ul. Samborska 3-5)
Free Admission
The opening reception of the exhibition of photos by Lech Basel. The evening will be accompanied by a piano concert by Stefan Gąsieniec & Tomasz Basel.
“Lech Basel has been listening to jazz and it was his passion for many years. Recently he found new passion: photography. This is how the “jazzographics” was born: the improvised records of emotions listened with the lens of the camera.”
For more info: www.klubformaty.wroclaw.pl

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Homoxymoronomatura]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/homoxymoronomatura/ 2007-11-09T06:54:59Z 2007-11-04T11:27:41Z 08.11.2007 - 19:07 (Thursday)
CAPITOL THEATRE (ul. Piłsudskiego 67)

The premiere of a new hip-hop project by L.U.C (from Kanał Audytywny) in collaboration with Rahim. This new project tackles on current global issues such as environmental disasters, war, poverty and other darker sides of humanity and the tragedies. The guest artists at this national premiere include Maria Peszek and Dawid Szczęsny.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Akosh S. & Gildas Etenevard]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/akosh-s-gildas-etenevard/ 2007-10-24T19:25:50Z 2007-10-24T19:21:01Z 26.10.2007 - 20:30 (Friday)
Jazz Club RURA (ul. Łazienna 4)
Tickets: 12/9PLN
A Ethno-Free-Jazz Project
Feat. Akosh Szelevényi (tenor & soprano sax, clarinet, Tibetan horn, ocarina, harmonium, Transylvanian flute) and Gildas Etenevard (drums, gardon, trumpet, percussion)
For more info: http://akosh.s.free.fr/

Akosh Szelevenyi was born in 1966 in Debrecen in Hungary. While studying the classical music in Budapest, he discovers jazz, Jimmie Hendrix, Led Zeppelin and Frank Zappa. In 1985, some troubles with the administration and the police force him to leave Hungary. In 1986 he crosses the Iron Curtain and arrives in Paris.
At the margin of the traditional French jazz environment, Akosh plays in the bars, where he meets several musicians. One of them is the band “Noir Desir,” and their invitation to take part in their tour subsequently launches his career in the main music circuit. In 2006, he composes the music for the contemporary dance performance by Josef Nadj, and their collaboration piece was presented at the theatrical festival of Avignon.
Akosh’s musical inspiration comes from Archie Shepp, Albert Ayler, Jonh Coltrane, Pharoah Sanders, Ornette Coleman, Don Cherry, Sun Ra, Charcie Haden and many other musicians and jazz lovers.


]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[“Trans-misja” - A Play in Gesture]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/trans-misja-a-play-in-gesture/ 2010-07-01T07:56:38Z 2007-10-24T08:56:24Z 26.10.2007 - 19:00 (Friday)
ARKA Theatre (ul. Mennicza 3)
Tickets: 20/15PLN
Seat availability limited
Book tickets at 071 344 3806 from 10am to 4pm
or by e-mail: teatr@teatrarka.pl
PrzeglądARKA: A Review of Talents, Ideas and Possibilities
Part 1. “Trans-misja” - A Play in Gesture
“A simple story on a less simple subject: about people who are in search of a relationship but at the same time cannot rid of a fear of getting trapped by it”
“Trans-misja” is the result of a co-operation of Artur Borkowski, Ewelina Niewiadowska and Paulina Jóźwin, who are also the excellent casts of the play. The performance was premiered in April 2007 during the Third International Art Festival “Mandala” in Wrocław.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays 2]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=383 2008-07-15T04:57:31Z 2007-10-18T15:03:52Z
08.10.2007-17.12.2007 (On Selected Mondays)
“Enjoy Mondays” (“Polubisz Poniedziałki”) is a series of concerts and exhibitions to brighten up the beginning of the week. The programme of this second edition follows the same idea as the first edition: present music from different historical periods as a set. Each concert will be unique, and pleasure will increase when you take more.

Programme:

08.10.2007 - EXHIBITION
“Ikony codzienności (Icons Of Everyday Life)”
by Ireneusz Pieczonka
Mleczarnia (ul. Włodkowica 5) 19:00, Free Admission

22.10.2007 - Concert: “LA MUSIQUE GALANTE”
Zbigniew Pilch - violin
Marta Niedźwiecka - harpsichord
Ossolineum, Refektarz (ul. Szewska 37) 19:00
Tickets: Normal 18PLN, Reduced 13PLN

Pietro Antonio Locatelli (1695 - 1764)
Sonata VI in D major [Largo, Allegro, Minuetto]
Jacques Martin Hotteterre le Romain ? (c. 1674 – 1761)
Les Voyages d’Ulysse [Allegro, Aria, Giga]
Johann Georg Pisendel (1687 - 1755)
Sonata in e minor [Largo, Moderato, Scherzando, ]
Luigi Boccherini (1743 - 1805)
Sonata IV in D major [Andante, Allegro assai, Rondo]
Jean – Marie Leclair (1697 - 1764)
Sonata VI in c minor [Grave, Allegro, Gavotta, Allegro]

29.10.2007 - EXHIBITION
“Faktura, struktura, skrzydło, papierowy neobarok (Invoice, Structure, Wing, Paper Neobaroque)”
by Adrianna Konopniak–Kaprowicz
Mleczarnia (ul. Włodkowica 5) 19:00, Free Admission

12.11.2007 - Concert: “LA FORZA GENTILE”
Marek Niewiedział, Marcel Plavec - oboes
Krzysztof Stencel, Dominika Stencel - horns
Kamila Marcinkowska - bassoon
Ossolineum, Refektarz (ul. Szewska 37) 19:00
Tickets: Normal 18PLN, Reduced 13PLN

Carlo Besozzi (1738 – 1791)
Adagio in A major for oboe solo
Joseph François Garnier (1755 – 1825)
Duos for 2 oboes
František Xaver Dušek (1731 – 1799)
Partita in G major for 2 oboes & bassoon
[Allegro, Menuetto, Finale]
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756 – 1791)
Duos for 2 horns
Franz Aspelmayr (1728 – 1786)
Partita in F major for 2 oboes, 2 horns & bassoon
[Andante, Menuetto, Presto]
Carlo Besozzi (1738 – 1791)
Sonata Nr. 13 in C major for 2 oboes, 2 horns & bassoon
[Allegro, Andante, Minuetto, Allegro assai]

19.11.2007 - EXHIBITION
“Forma jest pustką (The Form Is Emptiness)”
by Olga Osadowska
Mleczarnia (ul. Włodkowica 5) 19:00, Free Admission

03.12.2007 - Concert: “MINIMAL”
String Quartet MUSICARIUS
Mikołaj Zgółka - I violin
Radosław Kamieniarz - II violin
Piotr Chrupek - viola
Bartosz Kokosza - cello
Ossolineum, Refektarz (ul. Szewska 37) 19:00
Tickets: Normal 18PLN, Reduced 13PLN

Wacław z Szamotuł (c.1524 – c. 1560)
Już się zmierzcha
Henryk Mikołaj Górecki (ur. 1933)
I String quartet Już się zmierzcha […]
Arvo Paert (ur. 1935)
Summa
Grażyna Bacewicz (1909 - 1969)
IV String quartet
Vladimir Godár (ur. 1956)
Skládby pré slaćikove kvarteto
[Emmeleia, Neha, Jesenná meditácia]
Wacław z Szamotuł
Już się zmierzcha

10.12.2007 - EXHIBITION
“HOTEL”
by Tasz Yoke
Mleczarnia (ul. Włodkowica 5) 19:00, Free Admission

17.12.2007 - Concert: ELETTROVOCE
Agata Zubel - voice
Cezary Duchnowski - computer
Ossolineum, Refektarz (ul. Szewska 37) 19:00
Tickets: Normal 18PLN, Reduced 13PLN

Alejandro Viñao - Hildegard’s Dream
Cezary Duchnowski - Trawy rozczochrane
Agata Zubel - Parlando

Szymanki kurpianowskie
Szymborskie improwizacje

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Season 2007/2008 Opening]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=378 2007-10-02T06:12:49Z 2007-10-02T06:12:26Z
 
This September, Galeria Entropia opened a new season (20007/2008) with 2 exhibitions: an exhibition of paintings by Urszula Sądel (07-19.09.2007) and an exhibition/installation entitled “Neuro TV: Trybicon” (21.09-09.10.2007). In this episode of our video podcast, you will see the fragments of recordings from the opening receptions of these two exhibitions.
“Neuro TV: Trybicon” stays on display till Tuesday, 09.10.2008. Galeria Entropia (ul. Rzeźnicza 4) is open Mon-Fri, 13:00-19:00.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Yoga at Akademia Ruchu]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/yoga-at-akademia-ruchu/ 2007-09-30T17:50:28Z 2007-09-30T17:48:27Z 10:00-11:30 / Every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday
AKADEMIA RUCHU (ul. Ruska 47-48A)
A yoga workshop series by Basia Lipska, the instructor from Ashtanga Joga Japan (Tokyo). The course is open to everyone and for all levels (the beginners are also welcome). The instructor can communicate in Polish, English and Japanese.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Zbliżenie: XIII Young Cinema Review]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/zblizenie-xiii-young-cinema-review/ 2007-09-29T05:40:16Z 2007-09-29T05:33:20Z 30.09.2007 – 20:00 (Sunday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Musical Dialog 3: Justyna Szafran]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/musical-dialog-3-justyna-szafran/ 2007-09-24T08:18:15Z 2007-09-24T08:15:53Z 26.09.2007 – 20:00 (Wednesday)
MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
Tickets: 20/15PLN
“Musical Dialog (Dialog muzyczny)” is a series of concerts that mix the element of theatricality and privilege interaction with the public. Its third edition welcomes the singer/actress Justyna Szafran.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[IRENA URBAŃSKA & Klezmerzy]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=366 2007-09-23T08:45:34Z 2007-09-23T08:45:30Z 23.09.2007 – 19:00 (Sunday)
SYNAGOGUE “UNDER A WHITE STORK” (Synagoga Pod Białym Bocianem / ul.Włodkowica 7)
Tickets: 20/15PLN
Irena Urbańska & Klezmerzy from Kraków sing traditional Jewish songs.

Irena Urbańska - vocal
Lesław Lic - clarinet
Jacek Hołubowski - accordion
Jarek Wilkosz - contrabass

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Neuro TV: TRYBICON]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/neuro-tv-trybicon/ 2007-09-18T20:06:30Z 2007-09-18T20:02:23Z 21.09.2007 – 18:00 (Friday)
Galeria ENTROPIA (ul. Rzeźnicza 4)
Free admission
The opening of the new exhibition by two artists – Robert Lenard and Marek Zalibarek – and the live performance. This exhibition – “Neuro TV: TRYBICON” – is a product of a cooperation between Entropia and “Rita Baum” & “Puzdro” magazines, and experimentally brings together two different worlds in one space: the metal work of Lenard, on the one hand, and the graphic work of Zalibarek, on the other. The exhibition is open till 09.10.2007.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From the Archive: Dada von Bzdülöw]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=373 2007-09-12T18:02:14Z 2007-09-12T17:45:09Z
 
This episode of “From the Archive” series brings you another recording from the WrocławNonStop 2007. This time it is a dance performance. The title is “Magnolia,” performed by Dada von Bzdülöw.
This piece was presented as part of “Dance Vibratione” (Wibracje Taneczne) on 25.06.2007 at Scena na Świebodzkim (pl. Orląt Lwowskich 20c).

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From the Archive: JoJo Mayer Workshop]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=372 2007-09-04T05:26:56Z 2007-09-03T15:56:20Z
 
During WrocławNonStop this year, Gig-Ant invited JoJo Mayer from NERVE to lead a drum workshop. After the workshop, we asked JoJo Mayer to tell us a few words about his experience and idea of a drum workshop.

The workshop took place on 28.06.2007 at Firlej (ul. Grabiszyńska 56).

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Vito Capone + Jan Bortkiewicz]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=371 2007-08-28T11:14:21Z 2007-08-28T10:47:36Z 31.08.2007 - 17:00 (Friday)
Galeria DESIGN (ul Świdnicka 2-4)
A double opening reception will be held this Friday at a comtemporary art gallery Galeria Design.
It will present 2 new exhibitions:
“Istota rzeczy. Przestrzeń i Czas, Światło i Kształt (Essence. Space & Time. Light & Form)” by Vito Capone, and “Gra w czerwone (Play in Red)” by Jan Bortkiewicz.
Galeria Design is open Mon-Fri 11:00-18:00 and Sat 11:00-15:00.
Both exhibitions will stay on display till 23.09.2007.


From “Istota rzeczy. Przestrzeń i Czas, Światło i Kształt” by Vito Capone:

From “Gra w czerwone” by Jan Bortkiewicz:

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From the Archive: Manufactur @ Rura]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=369 2007-08-23T19:05:20Z 2007-08-23T19:04:34Z
 
The Summer is almost over, but our archive still has some unpublished recordings. Before the cultural life in Wrocław goes back to full operation, we will try to publish these lost materials as much as we can.
The first in the series is the recording of a concert by Manufactur back in April (20.04.2007) at Jazz Club Rura. The concert was organized by Gig-Ant and took place during the Wrocław International Jazz Festival “Jazz nad Odrą.”
Download: manufactur.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 20.83MB / 3:32)
Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Photo Exhibition: “Our Place”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=368 2007-08-02T08:12:25Z 2007-08-02T08:05:28Z 03.08.2007-12.08.2007
GALERIA DOMINIKAŃSKA (pl. Dominikański)
“Our Place - The World’s Heritage” is a UNESCO project to create a photo documentation of the sites listed in its World Heritage List. The exhibition in Wrocław displays selected photos from the collection.




]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Missa Sancti Iacobi]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/missa-sancti-iacobi/ 2007-07-25T11:24:49Z 2007-07-25T09:56:26Z 25.07.2007 - 18:00 (Wednesday)
GREEKCATHOLIC CATHEDRAL OF ST. VINCENT AND JAMES
(Katedrze Greckokatolickiej pw. śś. Wincentego i Jakuba / pl. Nankiera) - Free Admission
Schola Gregoriana Silesiensis will sing “Missa Sancti Iacobi” (St. James Mess) from famous manuscript Codex Calixtinus from 12th century.
Schola Gregoriana Silesiensis sang Ludus Passionis with Schola Teatru Wegajty back in March 2007.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Les Fêtes Françaises]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=365 2007-07-14T00:52:56Z 2007-07-13T13:07:36Z 3 Baroques Festival
13.07.2007-22.07.2007
3 Baroques Festival brings together 3 different baroque styles (Italian, German and French) in a series of concerts. With the title “Les Fêtes Françaises,” this year’s edition puts special emphasis on French Baroque composers.
Here is the full programme:

13.07.2007 (Friday) - 19:30
MUSEUM OF ARCHITECTURE (ul. Bernardynska 5)
Jan Dismas Zelenka (1679 – 1745)
Sinfonia à 8 concertanti a–moll ZWV 189
Allegro, Andante, Capriccio, Aria da capriccio, Menuet I i II
Georg Philipp Telemann (1681 – 1767)
Concert B-dur na dwa flety proste, dwa oboje, fagot, smyczki i basso continuo
Andante, Presto, Cantabile, Allegro
Johann Georg Pisendel (1687 – 1755)
Sonata c-moll na dwa oboje, fagot, smyczki i basso continuo
Largo, Allegro
Johann David Heinichen (1683 – 1729)
Concerto grosso G-dur Seibel 216
Andante e staccato, Vivace, Largo, Allegro
Johann Sebastian Bach (1685 – 1750)
Uwertura orkiestrowa nr 1 C–dur BWV 1066
Ouvertüre, Courante, Gavottes I i II, Forlane, Menuets I i II, Bourrées I i II, Passepieds I i II
Johann David Heinichen
Concertino z Mszy nr 9
Concerto grosso G-dur Seibel 215
Allegro molto, Adagio, Allegro
Antonio Vivaldi (1678 – 1745)
Concerto d-moll “per l’orchestra di Dresda” RV 566
Allegro, Largo, Allegro

utwory z “Deuxième livre de pièces de clavecin“ (1717)
XI Ordre “Les Fastes de la Grande et Ancienne“
1. Premier Acte. Les Notables, et Jurés - Ménéstrandeurs, Marche, Sans lenteur
2. Second Acte. Les Viéleux, et les Gueux, Premier Air de Viéle with Bourdon, Second Air de Viéle

ORATORIUM MARIANUM
TANT QUE VIVRAY
Songs, Psalms, Dance and Fantasy in French Renaissance

Tant que vivray an aege florissant (Claudin Sermisy)

21.07.2007 (Saturday)
Concert 1 - 19:30
ORATORIUM MARIANUM
“Concert in the form of Apoteosis”
Jean-Marie Leclair (1697 - 1764)
Deuxième Récréation de Musique op. 8
Ouverture, Forlane, Sarabande, Menuet I i II, Badinage, Chaconne, Tambourin I i II
Jean-Philippe Rameau (1683 - 1764)
Kantata “Aquillon et Orithie”
Michel Pignolet de Montéclair (1667 - 1737)
Kantata “Tircis et Climène”
François Couperin (1668 - 1733)
“Concert instrumental en forme d’Apothéose, composé à la mémoire immortelle de l’incomparable Monsieur de Lully”
“Concert instrumentalny w formie Apoteozy, skomponowany ku wiecznej pamięci niezrównanego Pana de Lully”
Lully aux Champs Elisés, concertant avec les Ombres Lyriques
(Lully na Polach Elizejskich Concertujący z Duchami Poetów.)
Air pour les mêmes
(Aria dla nich przeznaczona.)
Vol de Mercure aux Champs Elisés, pour avertir qu’Apollon y va descendre
(Na Pola Elizejskie nadlatuje Merkury, by obwieścić zstąpienie Apolla.)
Descente d’Apollon, qui vient offrir son violon à Lulli, et sa place au Parnasse
(Apollo zstępuje i ofiarowuje Lully’emu swoje skrzypce oraz swoje miejsce na Parnasie.)
Rumeur souterraine, causée par les auteurs contemporains de Lully
(Podziemny zgiełk wywołany przez autorów współczesnych Lully’emu.)
Plaintes des mêmes
(Lamenty tychże.)
Enlèvement de Lully au Parnasse
(Lully wyniesiony na Parnas.)
Accueil, entre doux et hagard, fait à Lulli par Corelli, et par les Muses Italiennes
(Słodkie, ale i złośliwe przyjęcie zgotowane Lully’emu przez Corellego i Muzy Włoskie.)
Remerciement de Lulli à Apollon
(Lully dziękuje Appolinowi.)
Apollon persuade Lulli, et Corelli, que la réunion des goûts français et Italiens doit faire la perfection de la Musique. Essai en forme d’ouverture. Lully et les Muses françaises. Corelli et les Muses Italiennes.
(Apollo przekonuje Lully’ego i Corellego, że spotkanie smaku francuskiego i włoskiego musi zaowocować doskonałością Muzyki. Próba w formie uwertury. Lully i Muzy Francuskie. Corelli i Muzy Włoskie.)
Air léger pour deux violons, Lully jouant le Sujet, et Corelli l’accompagnant.
(Delikatna aria na dwoje skrzypiec, w której Lully gra Temat, a Corelli mu akompaniuje.)
Second air. Corelli jouant le Sujet à son tour, que Lully accompagne.
(Druga aria, w której z kolei Corelli gra Temat, a Lully mu akompaniuje.)
La Paix du Parnasse. Faite aux conditions, sur la remontrance des Muses françaises, que lorsque on y parlerait leur langue, on dirait dorénavant Sonade, Cantade, ainsi qu’on prononce Ballade, Sérénade, etc… Sonade en trio.

Concert 2 - 22:00
AULA LEOPOLDINA
Performed by: B. Roed (flet prosty)
Guillaume de Machaut (ok. 1300 - 1377)
Se d’amer me repertoire
improwizacja
Moult sui de bonne heure nee
improwizacja
Douce dame jolie
improwizacja
Loyaté, que point ne delay
improwizacja
Tels rit au main qui au soir pleure
improwizacja
Dame, je weil endurer
improwizacja
Puis que ma dolour
improwizacja

22.07.2007 (Sunday) - 19:30
MUSEUM OF ARCHITECTURE
Jean-Marie Leclair (1697 - 1764)
Ouverture A-dur op. 13
Grave - staccato, Largo - Dolce, Allegro assai
Jean–Philippe Rameau (1683 – 1764)
Concert nr 6 g-moll ze zbioru “Concerts en Sextuor” aranżacji “Pièces de Clavecin en concert”
La Poule, Menuets 1 & 2, L’Enharmonique, L’Egyptienne
Antoine Dauvergne (1713 – 1797)
Concert de Symphonies nr 4 A-dur
Ouverture, Minuetto, Andante, Andantino gratioso cantabile, Vivace, Presto, Chaconne
Georg Friedrich Haendel (1685 - 1759)
Concerto grosso c-moll op. 6 nr 8
Allemanda, Grave, Andante allegro, Adagio, Siciliana, Allegro
Concerto grosso F-dur op .6 nr 9
Largo, Allegro, Larghetto, Allegro, Menuet, Gigue

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Perth Youth Orchestra]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=362 2007-07-02T19:08:38Z 2007-07-02T17:59:02Z
This July, Perth Youth Orchestra from Scotland is on tour to Poland and plays in Wrocław this weekend. The players of the orchestra are between 14 and 19 years old and come from central Scotland.
Here is the concert schedule in Wrocław:
06.07.2007 - 16:30 (Friday) RYNEK // small groups concerts
07.07.2007 - 18:00 (Saturday) St MARIA MAGDALENA CHURCH // full concert
08.07.2007 - 16:00 (Sunday) SZCZAWNA ZDRÓJ // full concert

The programme is as follows:
McCunn - The Land of the Mountain and the Flood
Greig - Two elegiac melodies
Kodaly - Hary Janos Suite
Plus a violin and a double bass concerto.
The ensemble programme includes traditional Scottish fiddling.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Brave Festival 3]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=360 2007-06-29T13:23:53Z 2007-06-29T13:13:09Z Brave Festival 3 - Drowned Songs
07.07.2007-14.07.2007
Brave Festival is a celebration of traditional performing art forms, and its programme includes spectacles and concerts by the artists from all over the world. This year, the 3rd edition of the festival brings to Wrocław such artists as Descendance (Australia), Beta Dance Troupe (Israel), Actores Alidos (Sardinia), Roudaniat (Morocco), Stari Koni (Ukraine), Bubun Tribe (Taiwan) and more.
The full programme in English is available here.

The music of Kanał Audytywny mixes the sound from many existing music genres: for example, jazz, hip-hop, trip-hop, down-tempo, and many more. This Friday (22.06.2007), Kanał Audytywny celebrates its 5th birthday with a concert at Firlej (ul. Grabiszyńska 56). In the interview we had at their last concert back in February, the backbone of the band - L.U.C and Spaso - talk about how they started the project “Kanał” 5 years ago.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Mandala Festival 3 - 1. Alain Gaudebert]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=350 2007-06-14T10:43:41Z 2007-06-14T10:40:59Z
 
The first episode of our Mandala Festival III (19.04-25.04.2007) video series presents a view from the exhibition of ceramic works by a French ceramicist Alain Gaudebert. In the interview, he tells us about his works (in French - the English translation of the interview is available below).
Download: gaudebert.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 10.49MB / 1:52)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
The translation of the interview:
“I am a ceramist from Bourgogne, France.
These faces were mostly developed at the time when there was a production, in the city of Auxerre, of Eugène Ionesco’s play “Jeux de massacre.” At that time, the director who was my friend asked me if I could do some work around this theme.
Other works presented here are about what we call “ceramic paper.” This technique mixes paper pulp with clay. With this, we can create extremely thin sheets of ceramic, like parchment. Sometimes they are barely 1mm thick. This technique allowed me to materialize my graphic work. The graphic work is transposed on ceramic material.
Obviously these works are burned at high temperature: in the wood stove, at 1300℃.“
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Rita Fest #1]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=348 2007-06-03T18:34:42Z 2007-06-03T18:22:20Z 04.06.2007-06.06.2007
The 1st edition of the festival organized by Rita Baum brings together editors of many Polish art & literary magazines in Wrocław for discussions. The topics on the table are: the situation of Polish art & literary magazines market, the relation between independent magazines and authorities, the literary ideology, the propagation of regional literary culture, etc. Also the concerts, performance and a short story slam are in programme [details here (PL)].

 Discussions  - INSTYTUT FILOLOGII POLSKIEJ (pl. Nankiera 15) & MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
 Performance  - DOLNOŚLĄSKI PUBLIC LIBRARY (Rynek 58)
 Concerts  - MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5):
Ziemia Planeta Ludzi /Wrocław/ jungle, ethno, free jazz (04.06.07/Monday/20:00)
Ba-lan Soundsystem /Warsaw/ roots reggae, dub, dancehall, jungle (05.06.07/Tuesday/22:00)
Brudne Dzieci Sida, Glebogryzarka P-45 /Poznań/ punk, acoustic (06.06.07/Wednesday/22:00)
 Short Story Slam  - 05.06.07/Tuesday/20:00 @MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Second [Third] Birthday]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=346 2007-05-31T15:29:29Z 2007-05-31T12:29:43Z 01.06.2007-03.06.2007
DROGA DO MEKKI (ul. Ruska 51)
Droga do mekki is a music club and this weekend, it’s celebrating its birthday with special events featuring O.S.T.R (PL), L.U.C (PL) and SWAYZAK (GB), etc. The club doesn’t remember exactly when they opened (some claims 2 years ago, and others say 3), so it is celebrating its second [third] birthday.
Here is the programme detail:

 01.06.2007 (Friday) - 21:00

O.S.T.R
L.U.C
+ after party: 2MUCH [twardy, spaso, spectribe]

also:

Sivy - decks

Karolin – wocal

A cabaret on stage
SKOQ’s drawings exposition

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Molière’s “Le Tartuffe”]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=345 2007-05-26T16:17:59Z 2007-05-26T16:14:52Z
 
Last year Teatr Arka adapted E. Ionesco’s “La Leçon” and presented it with the dialog mixing Polish and French languages. This year, they adapted Molière’s “Le Tartuffe” (”Świętoszek” in Polish) in the same manner. In the interview, the actor Alexandre Marquézy talks about the translation of Molière and the advantage of performing it today in the mixture of Polish and the original French.
“Le Tartuffe (Świętoszek)” premiered on 25.03.2007 during the Journées de la Francophonie 2007 and will continue to be performed through May, June and September.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
tartuffe.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 34.95MB / 6:44)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Zbliżenia XI - Łódź Film School]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/zblizenia-xi-%c5%82odz-film-school/ 2007-05-26T13:04:19Z 2007-05-26T12:53:43Z 27.05.2007 - 20:00 (Sunday)
MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
Ticket: 7PLN
The cycle “Zbliżenia” presents student films from the famous film schools all around the world. Its XIth edition puts the spotlight on Łódzka Szkoła Filmowa, the film school in Łódź, Poland, known by such eminent graduates as Andrzej Wajda, Krzysztof Kieślowski and Roman Polański.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Muslim Cultural Days 3]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/muslim-cultural-days-3/ 2007-05-17T12:11:43Z 2007-05-17T09:10:25Z 18.05.2007-20.05.2007
Free admission
MUSLIM CENTRE OF CULTURE AND EDUCATION in Wrocław (ul. Kasprowicza 24, www.islam.net.pl) organizes the 3rd edition of Muslim Cultural Days.
This year in programme are: interreligious discussion panel, mosque open day, dance and calligraphy workshop & more. Here is the full-programme:

Melting Siberia (2004) - Ido Haar / 72min
10:00-19:00 Book Market (THE COURTYARD OF THE SYNAGOGUE)
14:00-16:00 Israeli dance workshop by Małgorzata Rzempołuch
(WHITE STORK SYNAGOGUE / 5PLN)
16:00-17:00 Lecture on Contemporary Culture in Israel by Yossef Levy
(WHITE STORK SYNAGOGUE / Free Admission)
18:00 Performance by the theatre group RUTH KANNER
(WHITE STORK SYNAGOGUE / 30/12PLN)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Moustache Film Orchestra]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/moustache-film-orchestra/ 2007-05-10T07:38:20Z 2007-05-10T06:38:27Z 13.05.2007 - 20:00 (Sunday)
POLSKI THEATRE (ul. Zapolskiej 3)
Tickets: 30/20/10PLN
Moustache Film Orchestra is an orchestra of 50 musicians around the composer Marcin Mirowski. They play music mainly for films and commercials, and this is a chance to see the familiar tunes performed on stage.
At this concert, Moustache Film Orchestra will play such film standards as “Star Wars” and “Batman” themes as well as their original compositions, and some of the tunes will be accompanied by visualization.
More info: moustachefilm.com

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[George Dorn Screams]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=336 2007-05-03T06:50:24Z 2007-05-03T06:49:41Z
 
Here is the video snapshots from the last concert of the alt. rock group George Dorn Screams (21.02.2007, Bezsenność). As Wojtek Trempala from the band explains in the interview, the sound of George Dorn Screams is a combination of the alt. rock instrumental tunes and the haunting female vocal. The resulting sound is non-organic - even the catchy vocal tracks constantly remind the listener of their indie root.
George Dorn Screams returns to the stage of Bezsenność (ul. Ruska 51) on Wednesday, 09.05.2007. The concert starts at 20:00.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
gds.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 23.1MB / 4:27)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-No Derivative Works 3.0 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Breda Days in Wrocław23.04.2007 - 29.04.2007]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=331 2007-04-19T08:20:08Z 2007-04-19T08:13:46Z Week with Dutch culture: exhibitions, concerts, films, etc.
Event programme:

23.04.07 (Monday)
The evening of three exhibitions
17:00, Galeria Miejska (ul. Kiełbaśnicza 28)
Free admission
 - “Breda w obiektywie” - photos by Wessel Keizer present Breda, the partner city of Wrocław.
 - Paintings of Maud Quaedvlieg - an artist from Breda
 - Art Brut - works of artists from the Artilabo Galery (at the occasion of the Mandala Festival)

24.04.07 (Tuesday)
Painting workshops with Maud Quaedvlieg
10:00-16:00, Dom Edyty Stein (ul. Nowowiejska 38)
(it is necessary to contact the organizer and sign in before coming to the workshops: dompokoju@dompokoju.org)

19:00, Klub Łykend (ul. Podwale 37/38)
Free admission
A party at the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the visit of Qeen Beatrix in Wrocław and the Dutch help during the flood: performance by the Sygit Band, Dutch food and music.

25.04.07 (Wednesday)
Dutch movies evening
19:00, Atom Cinema (ul. Piłsudskiego 74)
Ticket: 5PLN
“De passievrucht,” “Rituelen” and the Dutch amateur movies.

26.04.07 (Thursday)
Qeen’s day
9:00-13:00, Wyspa Piaskowa
Dutch games for children and youth. (zaklopen, sjoelen and many others)
Free admission
The image of Poland in the Dutch media and the image of the Netherlands in the Polish media

Lecture by Edward Skubisz from the Department of Dutch Studies
Free admission

29.04.07 (Sunday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Husky in Concert]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=324 2007-04-09T13:05:05Z 2007-04-09T13:03:46Z
 
This is the video recording from the concert of Husky at Firlej (27.01.2007). After a few years of silence, Husky finally released their second album “Zgadnij” (”Guess” in English) at the end of 2006, and this concert was part of their album promotion tour. In the interview after the concert, the composer & producer of the band Jacek Dojwa talks about how Husky was formed and where it is going today.
Husky returns to Wrocław on Wednesday 11.04.2007 for the joint concert with Mikromusic at ALIBI (ul. Grunwaldzka 67). The concert starts at 19:00.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
husky.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 26.59MB / 5:09)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Ludus Passionis - Interview]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=323 2007-03-29T12:17:21Z 2007-03-29T12:14:45Z
 
On 29.03.2007, Schola Teatru Wegajty with Wrocław choirs will perform “Ludus Passionis” – the liturgical drama about Passion of Jesus Christ from manuscript Carmina Burana (13th century). We visited their rehearsals and interviewed the key personnel of this production about its play and music.
Ludus Passionis will be performed at ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST’S CATHEDRAL (św. Jana Chrzciciela / pl. Katedralny 18) on 29.03.2007 (Thursday) at 20:00. Free admission.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
passionis.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 33.68MB / 7:07)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Ludus Passionis]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=322 2007-03-29T10:33:22Z 2007-03-27T06:48:26Z 29.03.2007 (Thursday) – 20:00
ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST’S CATHEDRAL (św. Jana Chrzciciela / pl. Katedralny 18)
Free admission
Schola Teatru Wegajty with Wrocław choirs will perform “Ludus Passionis” – the liturgical drama about Passion of Jesus Christ from manuscript Carmina Burana (13th century).
The participating Wrocław choirs are: Pueri Cantores Wratislavienses, Schola Gregoriana Silesiensis, and Schola Mulierum Silesiensis.
For more information, please visit: Schola Gregoriana Silesiensis [PL]



photo: K. Sklodowski/Gazeta Wyborcza

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[From Francophonie 2007 - Yeti]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=321 2007-03-24T16:56:29Z 2007-03-24T16:54:47Z
 
The second episode of our video podcast from Journées de la Francophonie 2007 features Yeti (23.03.2007 @ Jazz club RURA). Their songs are all in French, and their concert itself is presented like a show in French. When everything is in French, it is not really clear how the non-French-speaking public would respond to such a concert, and for Yeti, this tour to Poland at the occasion of Francophonie marks their first tour outside of French-speaking countries. In our interview, the band’s vocalist & accordeonist Jetty Swart presents the band and talks about their experience of the tour in Poland.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
yeti.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 29.66MB / 5:47)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Łoskot & the Experimental Sound of Jazz]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=316 2007-03-13T07:06:13Z 2007-03-13T07:04:49Z
 
This is the video recording of the Łoskot concert at Firlej (16.02.2007). Łoskot is a jazz quartet, but their unique experimental sound has its roots not only in jazz but also in other music styles. In our interview, the saxophonist of the band - Mikołaj Trzaska - speaks about their diverse musical influences and also about the place of experimental jazz sound in Poland today.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[On the Body]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/on-the-body/ 2007-03-10T08:04:01Z 2007-03-08T01:35:56Z Ciało Festival (12.03.2007-16.03.2007) is a festival around the theme of “body” (”ciało”). Its programme includes the exhibition, performance and philosophy lectures. Here is the detail:
ARTMANIA (ul. Więzienna 21)
Exhibition: Marta Lech (12.03.07-16.03.07)
Opening reception: 12.03.2007 - 17:00 (Monday)

Galeria ! SPUTNIK (ul. Ruska 46c, 3rd floor)
14.03.2007 & 15.03.2007 (Wednesday & Thursday) / 17:00-20:00
Kalina Wińska – video installation “Oddzielanie”
15.03.2007 - 17:30 (Thursday)
Monika Konieczna – performance “Ciało”

MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
14.03.2007 (Wednesday)
16:30 Lecture: “Wstępny wykład o renesansie tematyki cielesnej” by Dr. A. Ostrowski
17:15 Lecture: “Ciało, jako droga hatha-jogi” by Paweł Jarnicki
18:00 Przemek Sanecki – performance
18:30 Lecture: “Medycyna i estetyzacja ciała” by Dr. J. Barański
19:15 Piotr Saul – beatbox, elektro boogie
20:00 Lecture: “Sade - metafizyka cielesności” by Dr. B. Banasiak
20:40 Józef Markocki – performance “Helioglobal” (monodrama)
21:30-23:30 Suka Off – videoart
15.03.2007 (Thursday)
16:00 Lecture: “Człowiek cielesny obrazem Kosmosu w świetle przedstawień ikonograficznych od starożytności do czasów nowożytnych” by Maria Weinert
16:45 Lecture: “Rozkład ciała przeniesiony w odwróconą perspektywę czasową… Manekin w teatrze T. Kantora.” by M. Szabat
17:30 Videoart projection
18:15 Lecture: “Ciało wyłowione z żywiołów - w myśli Heideggera, Derridy i Luce Irigaray” by Dr. M. Kostyszak
19:00 Teatr Tańca Arka – contemporary dance

Studio BWA (ul. Ruska 46a, 2nd floor)
15.03.2007 - 20:30 (Thursday)
Suka Off - performance

PUB KAMFORA (ul. Św. Antoniego 24c)
Photo-exhibition “Ciało”: Maciej Kaczor (12.03.07-16.03.07)
Closing reception: 16.03.2007 - 19:00 (Friday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Harpsichord Music Days 13.03.2007 - 17.03.2007]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=314 2007-03-07T08:51:13Z 2007-03-07T05:32:57Z Ars&Studium organizes the 3rd edition of Harpsichord Music Days (Dni muzyki klawesynowej). All concerts will take place at The National Ossolineum Institute Hall (Aula w Zakładzie Narodowym im. Ossolińskich / ul. Szewska 37).
Here is this year’s programme:
CEMBALO E SOPRANO
– Vocal & instrumental music of 17th & 18th century
13.03.2007 - 19:00 (Tuesday)
Marzena Lubaszka – soprano
Marek Toporowski – harpsichord

CEMBALO E VIOLINO
– Sonatas of J.S.Bach for violin & harpsichord/organo
14.03.2007 - 19:00 (Wednesday)
Ludmiła Piestrak, Mikołaj Zgółka, Radosław Kamieniarz – violin
Adrianna Gołos, Marta Niedźwiecka – harpsichord
Jan Tomasz Adamus – organo

CEMBALO E ORGANO – Biblical Sonatas of J. Kuhnau
15.03.2007 - 19:00 (Thursday)
Jan Tomasz Adamus – harpsichord, organo

CEMBALO SOLO – Partitas of J.S.Bach
16.03.2007 - 19:00 (Friday)
Adrianna Gołos, Ewa Mrowca, Aleksandra Rupocińska, Tomasz Głuchowski – harpsichord

DUE CEMBALI E AMICI – Concertos of C.Ph.E.Bach & W.F.Bach for 1 or 2 harpsichords, string orchestra & wind instruments
17.03.2007 - 19:00 (Saturday)
Aleksandra Rupocińska, Ewa Mrowca, Adrianna Gołos, Marta Niedźwiecka – harpsichord
Zbigniew Pilch – concertmeister
Festival’s Orchestra

Tickets:
15 PLN normal / 10 PLN reduced
Pass for the whole festival:
60 PLN normal / 40 PLN reduced

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Dziady - Part II]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=278 2006-11-30T04:54:50Z 2006-11-29T23:17:05Z
 
On Friday 24.11.2006, the new production of “Dziady - Part II” premiered at ARKA Theatre [see our previous post]. “Dziady” (”Forefathers’ Eve”) is a poetic drama written by Adam Mickiewicz and speaks of the “spirits” of the forefathers. In interview, the director Renata Jasińska talks about these “spirits” and also about this new production.
“Dziady - Part II” will be performed on 30.11.2006 (Thu), 01-03.12.2006 (Fri-Sun) and 08-10.12.2006 (Fri-Sun) at 19:00. Arka Theatre is located at the end of the passage at ul. Świdnicka 28.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
dziady2.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 35.51MB / 7:16)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Steamboat Switzerland]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=277 2006-11-26T06:41:19Z 2006-11-26T06:35:56Z
 
On Wednesday, 15.11.2006, Steamboat Switzerland played at RURA Jazz Club as part of the Rura Jazz Festival (07.11-03.12.2006). The music of Steamboat Switzerland is avant-garde and full of improvization and playfulness. In our interview, Marino Pliakas speaks about the band and its music, and also the impression of the concert at Rura.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
steamboat.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 29.18MB / 6:03)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

Steamboat Switzerland:
Dominik Blum (hammond organ, korg ms 20, electronics)
Marino Pliakas (guitar, bass)
Lucas Niggli (drums, percussion).

This concert was organized and promoted by Gig-Ant

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[CCP Finale moved to Sunday]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/ccp-finale-moved-to-sunday/ 2006-11-24T08:41:38Z 2006-11-24T08:28:00Z Because of the national mourning, the last concert of “Creative Commons Party” is moved to Sunday (26.11.2006). Other details remain the same: the concert starts at 19:00 at FUZON (pl. Teatralny 1) and Carizma and KredenZ will play. Admission free.
The national mounring will last till Saturday midnight (25.11.2006), and it may also affect other events.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[A Mickiewicz Drama at Arka]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/a-mickiewicz-drama-at-arka/ 2006-11-20T18:10:32Z 2006-11-20T17:49:48Z Adam Mickiewicz “Dziady” chapter II
24.11.2006 – 19:00 (Friday)
ARKA Theatre (ul. Mennicza 3)
Tickets: 15/10PLN
Arka Theatre presents the performance of a play Dziady (Forefathers’ Eve, written in 1823-32) by Mickiewicz. The performance premieres on 24.11.2006 and then it will continue on 27, 28 & 30.11.2006 at 19:00 and on 29.11.2006 at 11:00.
Arka Theatre is located at the end of the passage at ul. Świdnicka 28

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[ALIASCON 2006]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=272 2006-11-14T12:52:52Z 2006-11-12T11:35:53Z 17.11.2006 (Friday) / Opening
AMERICAN CORNER (Dolnośląska Public Library, Rynek 58)
ALIASCON 2006 is a festival of cartoons and graphic story-telling. This event aims to explore different views on cartoon forms and give an opportunity to the public to meet comic authors, publishers and other special guests.
Programme:
17:00 - Superman’s covers, 1938- 2006 // presentation by Andrzej Jarczewski
17:15 - Graphic Novels: Something for Everyone // lecture by Laura Caspari Hohmann. In English.
18:00 - The Death and Re-birth of Comic Books: An Examination of the Last 20 Years of Comic Books // lecture by Christian Dumais. In English.
19:00 - From the First Sketch to Publication: How a Comic Book is made // presentation by Marek Rudowski
The festival closes on 25.11.2006 (Sunday) at Medioteka.


]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Kristallnacht 2006]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/kristallnacht-2006/ 2006-11-09T10:09:26Z 2006-11-09T10:08:55Z 09.11.2006 (Thursday)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[The Ending and Beginning of being a Romanian]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=270 2006-11-07T20:09:03Z 2006-11-07T20:04:12Z 10.11.2006 (Friday) – 11:30
AMERICAN CORNER (Dolnośląska Public Library, Rynek 58)
Free admission
A lecture by Dr. Camelia Michaela Cmeciu (University of Bacău, Romania)
“On a bleak rainy day in November 2002, when George W. Bush visited Romania, a rainbow appeared in the sky, thus metaphorically ’sealing’ Romania’s membership into the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, which took place later in May 2004. Two years have passed since then and the Romanian society has been facing two major problems: on the one hand, a pledge of honor to America, despite the unfavorable polls concerning our presence in Iraq, on the other hand, the admission to the EU, despite the pervasive problem of corruption. These two issues can be linked to some ‘fundamental values’ (Alina Mungiu-Pippidi) about our perception of the Self and the Other, which are to be found in the sociological interpretations of two Romanian traditional ballads Mioriţa and Mason Manole…”
