]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Parklands Road at CCP]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=266 2006-10-28T09:12:18Z 2006-10-28T09:11:51Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[The Shape of Literature]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=265 2006-10-22T07:22:00Z 2006-10-22T07:11:59Z “Post Modernism and Post-Post Modernism: A Look at American Literature”
25.10.2006 (Wednesday) – 18:00
AMERICAN CORNER (Dolnośląska Public Library, Rynek 58)
Free admission
A lecture on American literature by Christian Dumais. In English.

“What happens when a character prefers not to? When the writer is suddenly a character in his own story? When the readers are supposed to get lost in the story they’re reading? From Herman Melville’s Bartleby the Scrivener to Kurt Vonnegut’s Breakfast of Champions to Mark Danielewski’s House of Leaves, this lecture will examine the differences in post Modernism and post-post Modernism, and how the two movements have altered not only literature but the process of storytelling. Fact blending with fiction, the destruction of chronology, the disruption of the basic shape of a story, the emergence of metafiction… there’s never been a more interesting time to read books.”
(”While it sounds stuffy and boring, it should be a lot of fun. Beer, however, will not be provided.” - Dumais)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Creative Commons in Action]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=260 2006-10-11T10:24:46Z 2006-10-11T08:21:52Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[America & the World]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=261 2006-10-10T11:06:08Z 2006-10-10T11:00:20Z America & the World - Editorial Art Exhibit
12.10.2006-31.10.2006
AMERICAN CORNER (Dolnośląska Public Library, Rynek 58)
The exhibit was the brainchild of Polish cartoonist Janusz Kapusta, a member of INX, and presents highly opinionated editorial page drawings by more than 50 illustrators on various topics: from today’s war on terrorism and gas prices to global warming. Displayed chronologically, the show serves as an illustrated history lesson full of biting humor, surprising insight, startling images and extraordinary craft.

INX (a play on “inks”) group was founded in the U.S. in 1980 by 12 political cartoonists trying to produce and sell uncensored political images. In 2002 the group decided to link with the United Features Syndicate. Newspapers and other publications download cartoons they wish to use. Their clients include the Boston Globe, the San Francisco Chronicle, the Seattle Times, and the Washington Post.
— Text by American Corner Wrocław

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Independent Films at SALVADOR]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=256 2006-10-08T05:38:58Z 2006-10-08T05:37:11Z 10.10.2006 (Tuesday) – 19:00
SALVADOR (pl. Solny 16, entrance from ul. Szajnochy)
Free admission
Mayan Productions present: Unusual Independent Film Projection
In programme:
“Stadium” (“Phase”) / “Pojedynek” (“Duel”) / “Bajka o smutnej królewnie” (“Fairy-tale about sad princess”) / “Pomyłka” (“Mistake”)

“Stadium” (”Phase”) - by Marek Cichy (Ex Nihil Group). The film that will shock everyone. It’s all about a phase, development phase,transitional state, etc.
“Pojedynek” (”Duel”) - by Marek Cichy & Ewa Martynkien (Ex Nihil Group). A beautiful story about alternate realities. “Angels are among us.”
“Bajka o smutnej królewnie” (”A fairy-tale about a sad princess”) - by Filip Rudnicki (Butcher’s Film). A tale of a girl in trouble for the first time in her life.
“Pomyłka” (”Mistake”) - by Sławomir Macuga (Kontraplan Film). A film about a mission and it begins with a simple telephone call.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[October at La Luz]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/october-at-la-luz/ 2006-10-02T15:13:44Z 2006-10-02T08:13:50Z LA LUZ
(ul. Krainskiego 14, tel. 0-661-927-476, www.laluz.pl)
The October event line-up at La Luz
03.10.2006 (Tuesday) - 20:00
TANGO AT LA LUZ
Inaugural opening of monthly Argentine Tango lessons, accompanied by music, stories and photography. Events will be led by Ana Szoc - Iberian studies, interpreter, photographer and enthusiast of Argentine Tango. Every Tuesday meeting there will be special Mexican kitchen and culinary Argentine surprises.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[TERRA INCOGNITA]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=245 2006-10-01T07:51:07Z 2006-10-01T07:14:28Z TERRA INCOGNITA (Music for violin solo, 17th century)
02.10.2006 – 19:00
ST. CHRISTOPHER’S CHURCH (Kościół Ewangelicko-Augsburski św. Krzysztofa / pl. św. Krzysztofa 1)
Tickets: normal 16zł, reduced 13zł, family (parents with children <15) 22zł / part of “Enjoy Mondays“
ZBIGNIEW PILCH – violin
programme:
  Johann Schop (1590 – 1667)
   Preludium
   Lachrimae Pavaen
   (originally for violin & basso continuo, transcribed by Zbigniew Pilch)
  Manuscript from Klagenfurt (17th century)
   Suite in A [Preludium, Allamanda, Courante, Gigue, Sarabanda, Double]
  Giovanni Battista Vitali (1632 – 1692)
   Partita sopra diverse Sonate [Toccata, Ruggiero, Bergamasca]
  Johann Paul von Westhoff (1656 – 1705)
   Suite III in H flat major [Allemande, Courante – Sarabande, Gigue]
  Nicola Matteis (? – 1713)
   Preludio
   Passagio rotto
   Fantasia
  Thomas Baltzar (1630 – 1663)
   Allemande
   Variations on a theme John come kiss me now
   (originally for violin & basso continuo, transcribed by Zbigniew Pilch)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Sesshin 2006]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=246 2006-10-01T19:35:18Z 2006-09-29T18:55:53Z
 
12-18.09.2006, the 4th Sesshin took place at Horakuji, Wrocław, in the presence of a Japanese Buddhist teacher - Yamada Bunryo. “Sesshin” is one week of intensive zen training, and Sesshin with Yamada Bunryo Roshi in Wrocław is held every year since 2003. We interviewed Bunyu who is responsible for the organization of this Sesshin, and we asked him how he started the practice of zen and what motivates people to participate in this zen training.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
sesshin2006.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 28.29MB / 5:34)
Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback

Horakuji was established in 2002 as a Buddhist temple, and its aim is to provide local practitioners a place and opportunities to meet teachers from various Buddhist schools and traditions. Horakuji also organizes regular zazenkai and some other Buddhism-related activities in Wrocław.
Horakuji is a part of Polish Buddhist Mission.

Buddhist Temple “Horakuji”
ul. Polkowicka 9a, Wrocław
e-mail: horakuji@mahajana.net
mobile: +48 601 705 736 (Bunyu)
http://horakuji.mahajana.net/

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Enjoy Mondays – Overture]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=244 2006-09-28T23:38:55Z 2006-09-28T20:51:07Z 01.10.2006 (Sunday) – 18:00
MLECZARNIA (ul. Włodkowica 5)
Free admission
18:00 – The projection of film ‘Nie lubię poniedziałków (I hate Mondays)’ (Poland, 1971) directed by Tadeusz Chmielewski
20:00 – The opening of the exhibition by Aleksandra Karbowniczek ‘The Corner of ul. Św. Mikołaja & Wszystkich Świętych’ (Till 07.10.2006)
“Enjoy Mondays” (“Polubisz Poniedziałki”) is a series of concerts that will fill up the often-empty Monday line-up and lighten up the beginning of the week. This Sunday “overture” will be followed by the 1st Monday concert on 02.10.2006.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[15.09.06 Entropia - Part 1]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=239 2006-09-18T08:03:29Z 2006-09-18T08:01:53Z
 
Here is the 1st of 2-part video snapshot from the opening of the exhibition “CROSSING” (15.09.2006 at Galeria Entropia).
“CROSSING” is a collaborative project of 5 young artists. They are all from different countries and they met in Weimar where none of them was native. We asked what motivated them to do an exhibition in Wrocław and what was the idea behind the project.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
crossing.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 26.19MB / 6:30)

Please use Quicktime 7 or VLC Media Player for playback
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Quartet Klezmer Trio]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/quartet-klezmer-trio/ 2006-09-17T19:38:54Z 2006-09-17T19:38:54Z 20.09.2006 (Wednesday) - 19:00

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Great Bicycle Parade]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/great-bicycle-parade/ 2006-09-16T09:07:18Z 2006-09-16T08:50:20Z 17.09.2006 (Sunday) - 13:00
PL. SOLNY (meeting point)
On the occasion of European Car Free Day and European Mobility Week, Great Bicycle Parade will take place on the streets of Wrocław. Everyone is invited to for the parade. The Parade will be accompanied by sound system & drummers on ricksha.
It will take over the streets of Wrocław - the parade starts in the centre and finishes at Park Południowy, where you can expect live music and some surprises.

In addition, on Friday, 22.09.2006, the public transport (trams and buses) will be provided for free for all. On the same day - at 16:00 in Mediateka (pl. Teatralny 5) - there will be a debate around the topic of sustainable commuting and transportation problems in Wrocław in the presence of city authorities and polititians.
More info (in Polish): www.eurovelo.pl, www.rowery.eko.wroc.pl
Organized by Lower Silesian Foundation for Sustainable Development
(Dolnośląska Fundacja Ekorozwoju) www.eko.wroc.pl

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Project: CROSSING]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=236 2006-09-15T05:51:45Z 2006-09-12T06:06:16Z The opening of an exhibition “CROSSING”
15.09.2006 (Friday) - 18:00
Galeria ENTROPIA (ul. Rzeźnicza 4)
Free admission
Accompanied by the performances:
 - Redglaer & Wanda Gala (USA) [performance "Goneness" /noise and movement]
 - Sitka (PL) [krew z kontaktu (KZK) + 3 (silence, noise, improvisation)]
Crossing is a collective project of five young artists who met at the Bauhaus University in Weimar: Dušica Dražić (SRB), Karolina Freino (PL), Sam Hopkins (UK/KEN), Teresa Luzio (P) and Vanessa Mayoraz (CH).

The works are the reflections of their personal experiences of leaving safe and familiar places and meeting its consequences in new, unfamiliar places. On the personal level, the “crossing” represents a challenge to one’s own limits, accompanied by fears and/or led by dreams. On the social level, it is the movement in the lack of stabilities in our society and is manifest in many different forms. For example, the search of an identity, asylum seeking, or the quest for physical and/or mental home, etc., are all either the result of or the very process of the “crossing” of given social boundaries and limits.
While focusing on the common theme of “Crossing,” each artist addresses the issue differently: crossing as a feature of a mobile society (Hopkins), as a phenomenon of displacement (Luzio), as a point of intersection between an outsider and a private network (Mayoraz), as a transgression in communication (Freino), or as a mixed feeling that having a home evokes (Dražić).
Galeria ENTROPIA is open Mon-Fri, 13:00-19:00.
The exhibition open till 27.09.2006.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[BuskerBus 2006]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=235 2006-09-15T05:25:00Z 2006-08-29T16:37:50Z 01.09.06 - 03.09.06 / 14:00-22:00
RYNEK

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Summer 2006 - Japanese Garden]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=232 2006-08-18T03:10:38Z 2006-08-18T03:09:40Z
 
The final episode of the Wrocław Summer video podcast series features Japanese Garden. Japanese Garden forms part of Szczytnicki Park. Szczytnicki Park was established in 1785 and it is the biggest and the oldest park in Wrocław. Japanese Garden was originally built in 1913 and reconstructed countless time in its history.
The video features “Minuet in D minor” by Deyo
Video download (iPod video compatible):
summer200604.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 12.76MB / 1:38)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Summer 2006 - Hala Ludowa]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=231 2006-08-11T05:07:11Z 2006-08-11T05:06:11Z
 
The 3rd episode of the Wrocław Summer video podcast series vists Hala Ludowa. Hala Ludowa (”People’s Hall”) was originally called “Jahrhunderthalle,” designed by a German architect Max Berg and built in 1913.
It was the biggest concrete architecture in the world to be built.
The video features “kiori no ride” by dimitris diavatis :: djjjimmy.wordpress.com
Video download (iPod video compatible):
summer200603.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 13.49MB / 2:12)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - ShareAlike 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Work in the High]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=233 2006-08-06T18:45:57Z 2006-08-06T18:45:02Z
 
On 02.08.2006, we followed a group of young people to the roof of the “Helios cinema” building. They clean the windows of high buildings as their Summer job. Still new to this business, they shared with us their excitement and thoughts about working at 50m above the ground, with only one rope to rely on.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
workhigh.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 34.57MB / 6:27)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Summer 2006 - Ostrów Tumski]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=230 2006-08-02T06:02:17Z 2006-08-02T06:01:02Z
 
This episode features Ostrów Tumski. It is the oldest area of the city of Wrocław and its heart is the St. John the Baptist Cathedral. Just like any other part of the city, Ostrów Tumski has been subjected to many changes in its history, and what we have today is the result of the changes over centuries. Rather than being simply a “historical” site, it consitutes a “spiritual” centre of the city of Wrocław.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
summer200602.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 12.48MB / 2:12)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[European Mime Academy]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=229 2006-07-27T08:15:47Z 2006-07-27T08:07:43Z Summer workshop 02.09.2006 - 17.09.2006
The school is run by Józef Markocki who is an actor and the director of the Form Theater.
The curriculum covers practical lessons as well as theory.
 - Plasticity and classic pantomime technique
 - Modern pantomime technique
 - Actor’s physical training
 - Actor’s elementary tasks
 - Body language elements
 - Japanese butoh dance elements
 - Classical dance /ballet/
 - Contemporary dance
 - Body and breath awareness, relaxation
 - Workshop open show
Download the full details of the workshop (RTF document, 11KB)
Costs:
1. Training sessions - 300 EUR
2. Accommodation - 100 EUR
3. Food - 100 EUR
4. Travel to Wroclaw and return- at your own expense
Application deadline:
If one wishes to attempt Workshop, he or she should pay beforehand half of the cost (that is 250 EUR) to 30.08.2006.
Account number and all necessary informations:
PKO PB SA III Odział WROCŁAW
53-149 WROCŁAW, POWSTAŃCÓW ŚLĄSKICH 60
code of the bank for the international payment (BIC / SWIFT) is: BPKOPLPW
Account number: 86 1020 5242 0000 2402 0115 7288
More informations: www.pantomima.pl and www.europeanmimeacademy.com

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Summer 2006 - Rynek]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=228 2006-07-26T11:51:52Z 2006-07-26T11:48:25Z
 
During this Summer holiday season, the WrocławWeekly podcast brings you the images and sound from the city of Wrocław and the area nearby.
The first episode of the series presents the Rynek of Wrocław. “Rynek” means in Polish a “market place.” “Rynek” in Wrocław is the city’s main square and constitutes the heart of the town-center, while in other cities it is not necessarily the case. The video is in the widescreen (16:9) format.
Video download (iPod video compatible):
summer200601.mp4 (H.264 / AAC / 13.43MB / 2:13)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution - NonCommercial - NoDerivs 2.5 License by Wrocław Weekly

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Summer Festivals]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/summer-festivals/ 2006-07-07T05:27:08Z 2006-07-07T05:25:08Z July is the month of international festivals. Starting this week, we see more concerts/performance from the following festivals:
Brave Festival: Voices of Asia
08.07.2006-15.07.2006
This year, Brave Festival brings us a wide range of events (from dance performance, projections, workshops to concerts) from various countries of Asia. See more information at: http://www.bravefestival.pl/
3 Baroques Festival
12.07.2006-23.07.2006
The 3rd edition of the Wroclaw 3 Baroques Festival features the mixture of 3 different baroque styles (Italian, French and German) performed by the same group of musicians. For more information (in Polish) at: http://www.3baroki-wroclaw.pl/
Evenings at Arsnal
30.06.2006-16.07.2006
The 10th annual chamber music festival presents a series of concerts featuring the folk and/or classical compositions from different countries all over the world. For more information at: http://www.wieczory-w-arsenale.pl/
See event details here: concert / performance

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[The World in Miniature]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/the-world-in-miniature/ 2006-06-29T17:12:44Z 2006-06-29T08:58:29Z A boat [...]]]>
INTERPONTES or mediaquatic routes
30.06.2006 – 18:00
Galeria ENTROPIA (ul. Rzeźnicza 4)
The exhibition of the miniature paintings by Piotr Szota. Wrocław is known as the city of many bridges & islands and built over complicated aquatic routes. The work of Szota explores the unique aquatic landscape of Wrocław in painting. Open till 14.07.2006.
30.06.2006 - 19:15
 > A boat trip to the sites depicted in Szota’s paintings, accompanied by the painter and a lute player. Limited number of seatings available.
01.07 & 02.07.2006 - 18:00
 > Visits to the sites depicted in paintings, guided by the painter, an art historian and an interpreter. Starts at Entropia Gallery.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Inside the WrocławNonStop 1]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=219 2006-06-28T07:48:19Z 2006-06-28T07:46:24Z

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Rockowania 2006]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=218 2006-06-25T07:19:34Z 2006-06-25T04:38:34Z 27.06.2006 & 28.06.2006 - 19:00
ŁYKEND (ul. Podwale 37/38)
Tickets: 8/5PLN
Wrocławski Klub FORMATY organizes this year its international 2-day rock summit at the club Łykend. The first day is more chill-out/jazz than rock, but on the second day the programme returns to its “harder” line-ups.
27.06.2006 - clubber day (Tuesday)
Mikromusic / Muzykoterapia (chill out/ jazz)
28.06.2006 - rock day (Wednesday)
Soomood (nu rock/ oriental) / Tlen (nu rock/ post grunge psychodelic) / Chaqma (millenium brutal hard core) / Snake Charmer (hard rock)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Regatta Reception at Hotel Tumski]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=208 2006-06-24T05:59:45Z 2006-06-24T05:59:35Z 26.06.2006 - 19:30 (Monday)
Hotel Tumski (Wyspa Słodowa 10)
Ticket: 10PLN
At the occasion of the 5th edition of the city VIP regatta on Odra river, Hotel Tumski organizes a concert by the group Karczma. Karczma will play songs of Jacek Kaczmarski.
On regatta:
The regatta will start at 17:00 from a wharf near Hala Targowa (DRIADA ship) and follows Odra river to the Summer Tarrace of Hotel Tumski. The major participants will include representatives of voivode Grzelczyk, of the mayor Dutkiewicz, and other local institutions.

Over the weekend, MUSLIM CENTRE OF CULTURE AND EDUCATION in Wrocław (ul. Kasprowicza 24, www.islam.net.pl) organizes with the university of Wrocław the conferences, photo exhibition and the mosque open-day, etc. [For the full programme listing, see below]
In this video podcast, we interviewed the key personels from the Centre about the aim of their activities and what they hope to achieve with the “Muslim Cultural Days.”
Video download (iPod video compatible): muslim_days.mp4 (H.264 /AAC / 10.10MB / 3:31)

Muslim Cultural Days
24.06.2006
Academic Conference: Islam in Poland and Europe - Prospects for cross-cultural dialogue (Lecture Hall of Institute of Pedagogy, University of Wrocław, ul. Dawida 1)
10:00-10:15 Welcome
10:15-11:45 Session 1: Cross-Cultural Communication
 - Islam contribution to the civilization
 - Islam & Europe as one civilization?
 - Ideology of fear
 - Islamophobia in Europe
12:00-13:30 Session 2: The Meeting of Cultures
 - Intercultural dialogue
13:45-15:15 Session 3: Religion & Intercultural Problems
 - Bridging a gap between Christianity and Islam
15:30-16:00 Discussion

Archidiocese Museum (pl. Katedralny 16)

25.06.2006
Mosque Open Day (Muslim Centre of Culture and Education, ul. Kasprowicza 24)
11:00-12:00 Visit to the Mosque 1
12:00-13:00 Lecture: Costume in Islamic Culture
13:00-14:00 Visit to the Mosque 2
14:00-15:00 Tasting the traditional Muslim dishes (Pakistani, Egyptian, Iraqi, Palestinian cuisines)
15:00-16:30 Lecture & Workshop: Basics of Arabic language and calligraphy
16:30-18:00 Lecture: Islam in the Media
A photo exhibition “Orient in lens”
19:30-21:00 Muslim Poetry Evening (FIRLEJ, ul. Grabiszyńska 56)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Meeting of Worlds]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=215 2006-06-22T17:42:56Z 2006-06-22T10:39:04Z 24.06.2006 & 25.06.2006
AROUND UL. WŁODKOWICA
Free admissions
“Meeting of Worlds” promote the unity of 5 religio-cultural traditions (Jewish, Catholic, Evangelical and Orthodox churches and Buddhism) in Wrocław. Over 2 days, there will be presentations, lectures, concerts and film-screenings in the vicinity of ul. Włodkowica. Here is the complete listing of the events:

24.06.2006
12:00-18:00 Open Day
Orthodox Church (ul. Św Mikołaja 40)
Synagogue “Under A White Stork” (ul Włodkowica 9)
Roman Catholic Church (ul. Św. Antoniego 30)
Evangelical Church (ul. Kazimierza Wielkiego 29)
Buddhist Centre (ul. Ruska 47-48a)
13:00-19:00 the market in the promenade on ul. Włodkowica
13:00 - Exhibition “30 years of ‘Way of Diamond’ Buddhism in Poland” (ul. Ruska 47-48a)
14:00 - Lecture “Reflection on Identity” by Waldemar Pytel
15:30 - Lecture “The World of Orthodox Icons” by Aleksander Konachowicz
18:00 - Film “Divan” by Pearl Gluck (Mleczarnia, ul. Włodkowica 5)
19:00 - A documentary film on Buddhist centres (Mleczarnia)
21:00 - Concert on the promenade: Boban Markovic Orkestar (Serbia) / Mahala Rai Banda (Romania)

25.06.2006
13:00 - Lecture “The Value of Life & Suffering” by Jerzy Kichler
14:30 - Lecture “On Happiness” by Zsuzsa Koszegi & Marcin Barański
16:00 - Film “Żertwa” (Mleczarnia)
17:00 - Film “Luther” by Eric Till (Mleczarnia)
19:00 - A concert with 4 choirs: Wrocław Orthodox Church Male Choir / Pueri Cantores Wratislavienses / Capella Ecumenica / Synagogue “Under A White Stork” Choir (Synagogue “Under A White Stork,” ul Włodkowica 9)

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[What is SIMCHA?]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=201 2006-06-07T20:30:17Z 2006-06-07T20:30:08Z The SIMCHA VIII: The Meeting with Jewish Culture starts on 08.06.2006. ]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Guinness Film Marathon in Film]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=199 2006-06-07T07:50:49Z 2006-06-07T07:47:53Z 09.06.2006 - 17:00 (Friday)
ATOM (ul. Piłsudskiego 74)
Ticket: 5PLN
Wrofilm and Akademickie Centrum Filmowe presents the premiere of the documentary film “Rekord” by Wojciech Jodko. Jodko followed day and night the Guinness Record Film Marathon (20.02.2006-25.02.2006) at ATOM cinema with his camera, and this documentary is the result. There will be also the screening of the daily video reports that we - WroclawWeekly - produced and published during the film marathon, and the slideshow of photos taken by the photographer Paweł Gorczyca. The download links to our video reports can be found here.
After the screening participants and volunteers will receive the certificates.
Afterparty in La Luz (ul.Kraińskiego 14).
The film marathon was brought to an end by the common decision of 4 remaining participants at 116hours 05min, after beating the existing world record; the record has been submitted to the Guinness Record authority and awaiting the validation.

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Steps to WrocławNonStop 1]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=198 2006-06-06T07:40:29Z 2006-06-05T19:11:51Z The WrocławNonStop Festival (23.06.2006-02.07.2006) is coming close. As every year, its programme is very colorful, but, just as every year, it is also very difficult to get an overview of the events. To help you get an idea of what to expect this year, we will be previewing in our video podcast some of the artists that you will see at the festival.
The first on our list is Neanderthal Alien (USA, etc.). Originally formed somewhere around Amsterdam, this ecclectic band got a boost in its evolution when a vocalist Dean Bowman joined. We interviewed the founder and the leader of the band, Ranjit Prasad, at Saraswati hotel in Świeradów. The additional video footage is from their concert in Poznań last Summer.
Neanderthal Alien will play at WrocławNonStop: Trip Hop & Urban Island (26.06.2006, Piaskowa Island, FREE), an event organized by Gig Ant promotion.
The next episode will feature the local Digit-All-love.
 Video download (iPod video compatible):
wns_gig01.mp4 (H.264 /AAC / 12.47MB / 5:17)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Futurallia 2006]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=197 2006-06-04T18:46:09Z 2006-06-04T12:10:34Z
 
Because we got a free press accreditation (worth 100EURO!) through the French Embassy office in Wrocław, we decided to be a tourist at Futuallia (01.06 & 02.06.2006). We walked around and filmed the event inside the main venue, Hala Ludowa (literally “People’s Hall,” a name that it inherited from the socialist era, but for some reason, referred at Futurallia always as “Centennial Hall,” the German name from pre-socialist era…).

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Rita in Action]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=191 2006-06-02T20:56:02Z 2006-06-02T20:55:01Z
 
The magazine “Rita Baum” organized its promotional presentation at RURA on 29.05.2006. ]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Traditional Song Workshop with OVO]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/traditional-song-workshop-with-ovo/ 2006-06-03T08:03:33Z 2006-06-02T06:00:13Z VI International Workshops of Traditional Songs of Middle-Eastern Europe in Lower Silesia
in two terms:
I : 18-25 July 2006
II : 29 July - 5 August 2006
Place: village Gaworzyce, Lower Silesia, near Polkowice/Glogow (see here)
Workshops are for all people who like singing. No previous experience is necessary; there will be also groups for advanced singers.
This is the series of workshops on the techniques of archaic/ethnic singing from various slavonic cultures. Workshops will be led by famous specialist of archaic singing - precursors of authentic music (the movement of reconstruction of archaic music in countries ex-Soviet Union in 70’s) such as Drevo or people connected with ensemble Kazachyj Krug.
The workshops will be also a place of meeting and exchanging the experiences between people from Poland and abroad, brought together by their desire to work with voice.
In programme:
 * work with voice and techniques of ethnic singing
 * learning polipohonical songs from slavonic traditions
 * workshops of traditional handcraft (cutting, paper-flowers, weaving, crochet)
 * meetings and workshops with local folk artists (from Carpathian Mountains, living now in Lower Silesia)
 * discussions
 * films and presentations
 * traditional dances
 * concerts
Instructors of vocal workshops (I term and II term):
 * Irina Nekrasowa from Russia - ensemble Mieża - workshops of Russian songs for mixed group (men and women) (I) and for women (II)
 * Jewhen Jefremow from Ukraine - ensemble Drewo - workshops of Ukrainian songs for women (I) and men (II)
 * Siergiej Olionkin from Russia/Lotva - ensemble Ilinskaja Pjatnica - workshops for women: of Russian songs (I) and songs from Podlasie (II)
 * Witold Kozłowski from Poland - OVO - workshops for mixed group of Bulgarian songs (I) and for women workshops of Polish songs (II)
Application Deadline: 19.06.2006
Fee (including programme, accommodation and board) for one week: 450 PLN
Organizer: The Foundation OVO for Culture and Education
Coordinator: Marzena Motyl
Full info about workshops here: www.ovo.art.pl
Contact: fundacjaovo@tlen.pl
phone. (+48) 71/792-68-68, (+48) 663-336-963

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[Cantilena at the Orthodox Church]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/index.php/cantilena-at-the-orthodox-church/ 2006-06-02T05:39:12Z 2006-06-02T05:39:12Z 04.06.2006 - 19:00 (Sunday)
St. Cyril and St. Method Orthodox Church (ul. Św. Jadwigi 15)
A concert at the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Male Chamber Choir CANTILENA

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[3 Pieces of the Fables]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=190 2006-05-30T22:36:48Z 2006-05-30T22:29:13Z
 
On 24.05.2006, in Wrocław, we had an unique occasion to see 3 pieces from “les Fables à La Fontaine.” “Les Fables à La Fontaine” is not simply a spectacle but, before being a spectacle, it is first of all a creative project that choreographs a series of “fables” by Jean de la Fontaine, produced by La Petite Fabrique (France). In this Polish tour, the following 3 pieces were in programme: “Le Corbeau et le Renard” by Dominique Hervieu (France) / “Contre ceux qui ont le goût difficile” by Lia Rodrigues (Brasil) / “Le Chêne et le Roseau” by Mourad Merzouki (France). Our video cast presents short extracts from each of these 3 pieces.
Video download (iPod video compatible): fables.mp4 (H.264 /AAC / 19.8MB / 5:34)
Please use Quicktime 7 (Mac/Windows) or VLC Media Player for playback

]]> 0 toyo http://www.wroclawweekly.pl <![CDATA[JoJo Mayer & NERVE]]> http://www.wroclawweekly.pl/?p=183 2006-05-29T09:20:46Z 2006-05-29T09:20:42Z 31.05.2006 - 20:00 (Wednesday)
BEZSENNOŚĆ (ul. Ruska 51)
Ticket: 25PLN
JOJO MAYER (drums, electronic beatz)
ROLI MOSIMANN (real time audio deconstruction)
TAKUYA NAKAMURA (keyboards, trumpet)
YOSSI FINE (bass, low end manipulation)
“JoJo Mayer & NERVE is a live Electronic Act from NYC that creates a new hybrid in contemporary music by cross pollinating intelligent DJ Culture (broken beats/d’n’b/nujazz, IDM etc.) with improvisational concepts of jazz. NERVE performes “reverse engineered electronic music” in REALTIME! (no DJ’s, drumloops or sequenced beats. everything is performed LIVE by drums, bass and keyboards).” (From Gig-Ant)
